Simulation_Type.description: Type of disease being simulated. Supported values include GENERIC_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, MALARIA_SIM, TB_SIM, STI_SIM, HIV_SIM, and PY_SIM. To query the values supported for your specific build, use the --version option.

Simulation_Duration.description: Elapsed time noted in days from the start to the end of a simulation.

Simulation_Timestep.description: Value indicating simulation time step in days.

Start_Time.description: Time noted in days when the simulation begins. This time influences the point in the temporal input data, such as where in the climate input the DTK starts running the simulation. Note: The Start_Day of campaign events is in absolute time. So, time relative to the beginning of the simulation depends on this parameter.

Enable_Demographics_Builtin.description: Uses demographics input files to configure the initial population. Enter 0 to use a standard testing sandbox which is useful for testing and validating code pathways.

Default_Geography_Initial_Node_Populatio.description: TBD - When using the default geography (i.e. Enable_Demographics_Builtin = 1), this is the initial number of individuals in each node.

Default_Geography_Torus_Size.description: TBD - When using the default geography (i.e. Enable_Demographics_Builtin = 1), this is the square root of the number of nodes in the simulation.  For migration, the nodes are assumed to be a torus.

Node_Grid_Size.description: Spatial resolution indicating the node grid size for a simulation in degrees.

Migration_Model.description: Model to use for migration. Possible values are: NO_MIGRATION and FIXED_RATE_MIGRATION.

Enable_Interventions.description: Set to 1 to load campaign interventions from file. Set to 0 to run a baseline simulation without campaigns.

Enable_Heterogeneous_Intranode_Transmiss.description: Set to 1 to enable heterogeneous intra-node disease transmission. Requires individual property definitions and beta matrix to be specified. Set to 0 to disable.

Number_Basestrains.description: The number of base strains in the simulation, such as antigenic variants.

Number_Substrains.description: The number of disease substrains for each base strain, such as genetic variants.

Immunity_Initialization_Distribution_Typ.description: Method for initializing the immunity distribution in the simulated population. Possible values are: DISTRIBUTION_OFF - All individuals default to no immunity. DISTRIBUTION_SIMPLE - Individual immunities are drawn from a distribution whose functional form and parameters are specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layers: 'ImmunityDistributionFlag', 'ImmunityDistribution1', and 'ImmunityDistribution2'. DISTRIBUTION_COMPLEX - Individual immnunities are drawn from an age-dependent piecewise linear distribution specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layer 'ImmunityDistribution'.

Serialization_Time_Steps.description: Array of time steps after which to save serialized state. 0 indicates initial state before simulation, n indicates after the nth time step.

Serialized_Population_Path.description: Root path for locating serialized population files.

Serialized_Population_Filenames.description: Array of filenames with serialized population data. Number of filenames must match the number of cores used for simulation.

Simulation_Type.description: Type of disease being simulated. Supported values include GENERIC_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, MALARIA_SIM, TB_SIM, STI_SIM, HIV_SIM, and PY_SIM. To query the values supported for your specific build, use the --version option.

Enable_Heterogeneous_Intranode_Transmiss.description: Set to 1 to enable heterogeneous intra-node disease transmission. Requires individual property definitions and beta matrix to be specified. Set to 0 to disable.

Number_Substrains.description: The number of disease substrains for each base strain, such as genetic variants.

Immunity_Initialization_Distribution_Typ.description: Method for initializing the immunity distribution in the simulated population. Possible values are: DISTRIBUTION_OFF - All individuals default to no immunity. DISTRIBUTION_SIMPLE - Individual immunities are drawn from a distribution whose functional form and parameters are specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layers: 'ImmunityDistributionFlag', 'ImmunityDistribution1', and 'ImmunityDistribution2'. DISTRIBUTION_COMPLEX - Individual immnunities are drawn from an age-dependent piecewise linear distribution specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layer 'ImmunityDistribution'.

Vector_Sampling_Type.description: Type of vector module used in a simulation. Possible values are: TRACK_ALL_VECTORS, SAMPLE_IND_VECTORS, VECTOR_COMPARTMENTS_NUMBER and VECTOR_COMPARTMENTS_PERCENT.

Egg_Hatch_Delay_Distribution.description: Is there a delay in egg hatching from oviposition? If so, how is that delay distributed? Possible values are: NO_DELAY and EXPONENTIAL_DURATION.

Egg_Saturation_At_Oviposition.description: Is there saturation in the number of viable eggs at oviposition depending on available larval habitat? Possible values are: NO_SATURATION and SATURATION_AT_OVIPOSITION.

Larval_Density_Dependence.description: Set to UNIFORM_WHEN_OVERPOPULATION to apply mortality uniformly to all larvae when the population exceeds the specified carrying capacity for that habitat. Set to GRADUAL_INSTAR_SPECIFIC to apply mortality and delayed growth in an instar-specific fashion where the younger larvae are more susceptible to predation and competition from older larvae. The LARVAL_AGE_DENSITY_DEPENDENT_MORTALITY_ONLY and DENSITY_DELAYED_GROWTH_NOT_MORTALITY options configure only the age-dependent mortality componenent or only the delayed-growth component, respectively. For the NO_DENSITY_DEPENDENCE option, there is no additional larval density-dependent mortality factor. Possible values are: UNIFORM_WHEN_OVERPOPULATION, GRADUAL_INSTAR_SPECIFIC, LARVAL_AGE_DENSITY_DEPENDENT_MORTALITY_ONLY, DENSITY_DELAYED_GROWTH_NOT_MORTALITY, NO_DENSITY_DEPENDENCE.

Egg_Hatch_Density_Dependence.description: If set to true, egg hatching is delayed as a function of larval density, similar to larval_density_dependence. Possbile values are: DENSITY_DEPENDENCE and NO_DENSITY_DEPENDENCE.

Vector_Sugar_Feeding_Frequency.description: How often does a female mosquito take a sugar feed? Possible values are: VECTOR_SUGAR_FEEDING_NONE - No sugar feeding. VECTOR_SUGAR_FEEDING_ON_EMERGENCE_ONLY - Sugar feeding once at emergence. VECTOR_SUGAR_FEEDING_EVERY_FEED - Sugar feeding occurs once per blood meal. VECTOR_SUGAR_FEEDING_EVERY_DAY - Sugar feeding occurs everyday. Note: This parameter is used in conjunction with the SugarTrap and OvipositionTrap interventions. These features require Vector_Sampling_Type to be set to TRACK_ALL_VECTORS or SAMPLE_IND_VECTORS.

Vector_Larval_Rainfall_Mortality.description: Type of vector larval mortality function due to rainfall.  Possible values are NONE, SIGMOID, where the mortality rate grows linearly from 0 at the threshold to 1 at twice the threshold value, and SIGMOID_HABITAT_SHIFTING, where the threshold value is reduced by a factor proportional to how full the larval habitat is.

Larval_Rainfall_Mortality_Threshold.description: The threshold value on daily rainfall in millimeters, above which larval mortality is applied when Vector_Larval_Rainfall_Mortality is set to either SIGMOID or SIGMOID_HABITAT_SHIFTING.

Enable_Temperature_Dependent_Egg_Hatchin.description: Set to 1 to include a temperature effect on egg hatching, defined by Egg_arrhenius 1 & 2.

Egg_Arrhenius1.description: First parameter that defines the temperature dependent egg hatching

Egg_Arrhenius2.description: Second parameter that defines the temperature dependent egg hatching

Enable_Egg_Mortality.description: Set to 1 to include a daily mortality rate on the egg population, defined by 1 - Egg_Survival_Rate

Drought_Egg_Hatch_Delay.description: Proportion of regular egg hatching that still occurs when habitat dries up.

Larval_Density_Mortality_Scalar.description: A scale factor in the formula determining the larval-age-dependent mortality for the GRADUAL_INSTAR_SPECIFIC and LARVAL_AGE_DENSITY_DEPENDENT_MORTALITY_ONLY models.

Larval_Density_Mortality_Offset.description: An offset factor in the formula determining the larval-age-dependent mortality for the GRADUAL_INSTAR_SPECIFIC and LARVAL_AGE_DENSITY_DEPENDENT_MORTALITY_ONLY models.

HEG_Model.description: An enum governing the homing endonuclease gene (HEG) dynamics. Possible values are: OFF, GERMLINE_HOMING (early), EGG_HOMING (late).

HEG_Homing_Rate.description: The fractional redistribution from heterozygous offspring to the homozygous homing-endonuclease-gene (HEG) behavior.

HEG_Fecundity_Limiting.description: The fractional reduction in the number of eggs laid by a female mosquito who is homozygous in the homing endonuclease gene (HEG).

Enable_Vector_Aging.description: Set to 1 to simulate vector senescence. Set to 0 to assume that vector behavior does not change with age.

Temperature_Dependent_Feeding_Cycle.description: Set to ARRHENIUS_DEPENDENCE or BOUNDED_DEPENDENCE to have the duration between blood-feeds depend on the temperature. Option 1 follows the arrhenius equation with parameters cycle_arrhenius 1 and 2. Option 2 follows an equation bounded at 10 days at 15 degrees celcius and use 'Days_Between_Feeds' to set the duration at 30 degrees Celsius.  Otherwise, if set to NO_TEMPERATURE_DEPENDENCE, days between feeds will be constant and specified by the parameter 'Days_Between_Feeds' for each species.

Mean_Egg_Hatch_Delay.description: Mean delay in egg hatch time noted in days from the time of oviposition.

Wolbachia_Mortality_Modification.description: The change in vector mortality due to a Wolbachia infection.

Wolbachia_Infection_Modification.description: The change in vector susceptibility to infection due to a Wolbachia infection.

Human_Feeding_Mortality.description: Fraction (dimensionless) of mosquitoes that die while feeding on a human. As of version 1.5, this is now a one-value-per-simulation quantity.

Temporary_Habitat_Decay_Factor.description: Factor to convert raw evaporation rate (ignoring boundary layer effects) to the daily rate of larval habitat loss for temporary habitats with Habitat_Type parameter of TEMPORARY_RAINFALL.  Units are (larval carrying capacity per day) / (kg per square meter per second).

Semipermanent_Habitat_Decay_Rate.description: Daily rate of larval habitat loss for semi-permanent habitats with Habitat_Type parameter of WATER_VEGETATION or BRACKISH_SWAMP.

Rainfall_In_mm_To_Fill_Swamp.description: Millimeters of rain to fill larval habitat to capacity. Only used for vector species with Habitat_Type set to BRACKISH_SWAMP.

x_Temporary_Larval_Habitat.description: Scales the habitat size for all mosquito populations.

Vector_Species_Names.description: An array of vector species names for all species that are present in the simulation. For example, ['arabiensis', 'funestus', 'gambiae'].

Serialization_Time_Steps.description: Array of time steps after which to save serialized state. 0 indicates initial state before simulation, n indicates after the nth time step.

Serialized_Population_Path.description: Root path for locating serialized population files.

Serialized_Population_Filenames.description: Array of filenames with serialized population data. Number of filenames must match the number of cores used for simulation.

Larval_Habitat_Types.description: A measure of the habitat type and scaling factors to use to estimate larval population. You can specify this with a dictionary specifying habitat type with a simple numeric scaling factor or, for LINEAR_SPLINE, with a more detailed configuration for scaling. Possible habitat values are: CONSTANT TEMPORARY_RAINFALL WATER_VEGETATION HUMAN_POPULATION BRACKISH_SWAMP LINEAR_SPLINE.

Aquatic_Arrhenius_1.description: The duration of aquatic development is a decreasing function of temperature.  The daily rate of fractional progression from egg-hatching to emergence is parameterized by the Arrhenius equation, a1 * exp( -a2 / T ), with T in degrees Kelvin.  This parameter, a1, is a temperature-independent scale factor on the development rate.  Reference: Craig M.H., Snow R.W., et al. (1999). A climate-based distribution model of malaria transmission in sub-Saharan Africa. Parasitology Today 15(3) 105-111.

Aquatic_Arrhenius_2.description: The duration of aquatic development is a decreasing function of temperature.  The daily rate of fractional progression from egg-hatching to emergence is parameterized by the Arrhenius equation, a1 * exp( -a2 / T ), with T in degrees Kelvin.   This parameter, a2, governs how quickly the rate changes with temperature. Reference: Craig M.H., Snow R.W., et al. (1999). A climate-based distribution model of malaria transmission in sub-Saharan Africa. Parasitology Today 15(3) 105-111.

Infected_Arrhenius_1.description: The duration of sporogony is a decreasing function of temperature.  The daily rate of fractional progression of infected mosquitoes to an infectious state is parameterized by the Arrhenius equation, a1 * exp( -a2 / T ), with T in degrees Kelvin.   This parameter, a1, is a temperature-independent scale factor on the development rate.  Reference: Craig M.H., Snow R.W., et al. (1999). A climate-based distribution model of malaria transmission in sub-Saharan Africa. Parasitology Today 15(3) 105-111.

Infected_Arrhenius_2.description: The duration of sporogony is a decreasing function of temperature.  The daily rate of fractional progression of infected mosquitoes to an infectious state is parameterized by the Arrhenius equation, a1 * exp( -a2 / T ), with T in degrees Kelvin.   This parameter, a2, governs how quickly the rate changes with temperature.   Reference: Craig M.H., Snow R.W., et al. (1999). A climate-based distribution model of malaria transmission in sub-Saharan Africa. Parasitology Today 15(3) 105-111.

Cycle_Arrhenius_1.description: The duration of the feeding cycle is a decreasing function of temperature.  The daily rate is parameterized by the Arrhenius equation, a1 * exp( -a2 / T ), with T in degrees Kelvin.  This parameter, a1, is a temperature-independent scale factor on the rate at which a mosquito goes through is feeding cycle. Focks, D. A., et al. Dynamic life table model for Aedes aegypti (Diptera: Culicidae): simulation results and validation. Journal of Medical Entomology30.6 (1993): 1018-1028.

Cycle_Arrhenius_2.description: The duration of the feeding cycle is a decreasing function of temperature.  The daily rate is parameterized by the Arrhenius equation, a1 * exp( -a2 / T ), with T in degrees Kelvin.  This parameter, a2, governs how quickly the rate changes with temperature.  Reference: Focks, D. A., et al. Dynamic life table model for Aedes aegypti (Diptera: Culicidae): simulation results and validation. Journal of Medical Entomology30.6 (1993): 1018-1028.

Cycle_Arrhenius_Reduction_Factor.description: The duration of subsequent cycles, from oviposition to oviposition, is shorter because primary follicles are at stage II following oviposition rather than I in the case of newly emerged females.  Reference: Focks, D. A., et al. Dynamic life table model for Aedes aegypti (Diptera: Culicidae): simulation results and validation. Journal of Medical Entomology30.6 (1993): 1018-1028.

Immature_Duration.description: Factor (in days) used to calculate the rate at which immature organisms develop into adult mosquitoes, which equals 1 / (value of this parameter). Note that development from immature individual to adult is not dependent on temperature.

Days_Between_Feeds.description: Factor (in days) used to calculate the rate at which female mosquitoes attempt to feed. The rate equals 1 / (value of this parameter). The Days_Between_Feeds parameter represents a 3-day feeding cycle at normal tropical temperatures (30 C). If it is colder, the cycle is 4 days at 24 C, and if the temperature is warmer, the cycle is shorter, increasing the fraction of 2-day cycles from 30 C to 48 C. Whole temperature-dependent distribution can be shifted by changing Days_Between_Feeds which is always the value at 30 C. See Enable_Temperature_Dependent_Feeding_Cycle for weather-dependent feeding.

Anthropophily.description: Propensity (dimensionless) of the mosquito to feed on humans instead of animals, measured as a fraction of blood meals from human hosts. This propensity is important in differentiating the mosquito species.

Egg_Batch_Size.description: Size of egg batch laid by one female mosquito that has fed successfully.

Infected_Egg_Batch_Factor.description: Factor (dimensionless) used to modify egg batch size to account for effects of infection in a female mosquito. Female mosquitoes undergoing sporogony have reduced fertility.

Aquatic_Mortality_Rate.description: Base aquatic mortality per day for the species before adjustment for effects of overpopulation and drying. The rate is locally adjusted for other considerations, including overpopulation and drying out of the aquatic habitat.

Adult_Life_Expectancy.description: Number of days an average mosquito survives. The daily adult mortality rate is 1 / (value of this parameter).

Transmission_Rate.description: Probability of success of an infectious bite on an immunologically naive and uninfected individual, or the modifier of the probability of success for an individual with pre-erythrocytic immunity.

Acquire_Modifier.description: Modifier of the probability of successful infection of a mosquito by a malaria-infected individual, given the individual's infectiousness.

Infectious_Human_Feed_Mortality_Factor.description: Correction factor (dimensionless) used to modify the death rate of mosquitoes when feeding on humans, to account for the increase caused by infections in mosquitoes. Infected mosquitoes have a higher mortality rate while feeding on humans than uninfected mosquitoes.  References: Wekesa J. W., Copeland R. S. , et al. (1992). Effect of Plasmodium Falciparum on Blood Feeding Behavior of Naturally Infected Anopheles Mosquitoes in Western Kenya. Am J Trop Med Hyg 47(4): 484-488.Anderson R. A., Knols B. G. J., et al. (2000). Plasmodium falciparum sporozoites increase feeding-associated mortality of their mosquito hosts Anopheles gambiae s.l. Parasitology 120(04): 329-333.

Indoor_Feeding_Fraction.description: Fraction (dimensionless) of feeds on humans that occur indoors. Thus the fraction of feeds on humans that occur outdoors equals 1 - (value of this parameter).

Nighttime_Feeding_Fraction.description: Fraction (dimensionless) of feeds on humans that occur during the nighttime. Thus the fraction of feeds on humans that occur during the day equals 1 - (value of this parameter).

Semipermanent_Habitat_Decay_Rate.description: Daily rate of larval habitat loss for semi-permanent habitats with Habitat_Type parameter of WATER_VEGETATION or BRACKISH_SWAMP.

Rainfall_In_mm_To_Fill_Swamp.description: Millimeters of rain to fill larval habitat to capacity. Only used for vector species with Habitat_Type set to BRACKISH_SWAMP.

x_Temporary_Larval_Habitat.description: Scales the habitat size for all mosquito populations.

Vector_Species_Names.description: An array of vector species names for all species that are present in the simulation. For example, ['arabiensis', 'funestus', 'gambiae'].

PKPD_Model.description: Determines which pharmacokinetic pharmacodynamic module to use. Possible values are: FIXED_DURATION_CONSTANT_EFFECT and CONCENTRATION_VERSUS_TIME.

Falciparum_MSP_Variants.description: The number of distinct MSP variants for P. falciparum malaria in the overall parasite population in the simulation, not necessarily in an individual.

Falciparum_Nonspecific_Types.description: The number of distinct non-specific types of P. falciparum malaria.

Falciparum_PfEMP1_Variants.description: The number of distinct PfEMP1 variants for P. falciparum malaria in the overall parasite population in the simulation.

Fever_Detection_Threshold.description: Level of body temperature above normal, in degrees Celsius, corresponding to detectable fever. Normal body temperature is defined as 37 degrees Celsius.

Parasite_Smear_Sensitivity.description: The number of microliters of blood tested to find single parasites in a traditional smear (corresponds to inverse parasites/microliters sensitivity).

New_Diagnostic_Sensitivity.description: The number of microliters of blood tested to find single parasites in a new diagnostic (corresponds to inverse parasites/microliters sensitivity).

Serialization_Time_Steps.description: Array of time steps after which to save serialized state. 0 indicates initial state before simulation, n indicates after the nth time step.

Serialized_Population_Path.description: Root path for locating serialized population files.

Serialized_Population_Filenames.description: Array of filenames with serialized population data. Number of filenames must match the number of cores used for simulation.

Larval_Habitat_Types.description: A measure of the habitat type and scaling factors to use to estimate larval population. You can specify this with a dictionary specifying habitat type with a simple numeric scaling factor or, for LINEAR_SPLINE, with a more detailed configuration for scaling. Possible habitat values are: CONSTANT TEMPORARY_RAINFALL WATER_VEGETATION HUMAN_POPULATION BRACKISH_SWAMP LINEAR_SPLINE.

Aquatic_Arrhenius_1.description: The duration of aquatic development is a decreasing function of temperature.  The daily rate of fractional progression from egg-hatching to emergence is parameterized by the Arrhenius equation, a1 * exp( -a2 / T ), with T in degrees Kelvin.  This parameter, a1, is a temperature-independent scale factor on the development rate.  Reference: Craig M.H., Snow R.W., et al. (1999). A climate-based distribution model of malaria transmission in sub-Saharan Africa. Parasitology Today 15(3) 105-111.

Aquatic_Arrhenius_2.description: The duration of aquatic development is a decreasing function of temperature.  The daily rate of fractional progression from egg-hatching to emergence is parameterized by the Arrhenius equation, a1 * exp( -a2 / T ), with T in degrees Kelvin.   This parameter, a2, governs how quickly the rate changes with temperature. Reference: Craig M.H., Snow R.W., et al. (1999). A climate-based distribution model of malaria transmission in sub-Saharan Africa. Parasitology Today 15(3) 105-111.

Infected_Arrhenius_1.description: The duration of sporogony is a decreasing function of temperature.  The daily rate of fractional progression of infected mosquitoes to an infectious state is parameterized by the Arrhenius equation, a1 * exp( -a2 / T ), with T in degrees Kelvin.   This parameter, a1, is a temperature-independent scale factor on the development rate.  Reference: Craig M.H., Snow R.W., et al. (1999). A climate-based distribution model of malaria transmission in sub-Saharan Africa. Parasitology Today 15(3) 105-111.

Infected_Arrhenius_2.description: The duration of sporogony is a decreasing function of temperature.  The daily rate of fractional progression of infected mosquitoes to an infectious state is parameterized by the Arrhenius equation, a1 * exp( -a2 / T ), with T in degrees Kelvin.   This parameter, a2, governs how quickly the rate changes with temperature.   Reference: Craig M.H., Snow R.W., et al. (1999). A climate-based distribution model of malaria transmission in sub-Saharan Africa. Parasitology Today 15(3) 105-111.

Cycle_Arrhenius_1.description: The duration of the feeding cycle is a decreasing function of temperature.  The daily rate is parameterized by the Arrhenius equation, a1 * exp( -a2 / T ), with T in degrees Kelvin.  This parameter, a1, is a temperature-independent scale factor on the rate at which a mosquito goes through is feeding cycle. Focks, D. A., et al. Dynamic life table model for Aedes aegypti (Diptera: Culicidae): simulation results and validation. Journal of Medical Entomology30.6 (1993): 1018-1028.

Cycle_Arrhenius_2.description: The duration of the feeding cycle is a decreasing function of temperature.  The daily rate is parameterized by the Arrhenius equation, a1 * exp( -a2 / T ), with T in degrees Kelvin.  This parameter, a2, governs how quickly the rate changes with temperature.  Reference: Focks, D. A., et al. Dynamic life table model for Aedes aegypti (Diptera: Culicidae): simulation results and validation. Journal of Medical Entomology30.6 (1993): 1018-1028.

Cycle_Arrhenius_Reduction_Factor.description: The duration of subsequent cycles, from oviposition to oviposition, is shorter because primary follicles are at stage II following oviposition rather than I in the case of newly emerged females.  Reference: Focks, D. A., et al. Dynamic life table model for Aedes aegypti (Diptera: Culicidae): simulation results and validation. Journal of Medical Entomology30.6 (1993): 1018-1028.

Immature_Duration.description: Factor (in days) used to calculate the rate at which immature organisms develop into adult mosquitoes, which equals 1 / (value of this parameter). Note that development from immature individual to adult is not dependent on temperature.

Days_Between_Feeds.description: Factor (in days) used to calculate the rate at which female mosquitoes attempt to feed. The rate equals 1 / (value of this parameter). The Days_Between_Feeds parameter represents a 3-day feeding cycle at normal tropical temperatures (30 C). If it is colder, the cycle is 4 days at 24 C, and if the temperature is warmer, the cycle is shorter, increasing the fraction of 2-day cycles from 30 C to 48 C. Whole temperature-dependent distribution can be shifted by changing Days_Between_Feeds which is always the value at 30 C. See Enable_Temperature_Dependent_Feeding_Cycle for weather-dependent feeding.

Anthropophily.description: Propensity (dimensionless) of the mosquito to feed on humans instead of animals, measured as a fraction of blood meals from human hosts. This propensity is important in differentiating the mosquito species.

Egg_Batch_Size.description: Size of egg batch laid by one female mosquito that has fed successfully.

Infected_Egg_Batch_Factor.description: Factor (dimensionless) used to modify egg batch size to account for effects of infection in a female mosquito. Female mosquitoes undergoing sporogony have reduced fertility.

Aquatic_Mortality_Rate.description: Base aquatic mortality per day for the species before adjustment for effects of overpopulation and drying. The rate is locally adjusted for other considerations, including overpopulation and drying out of the aquatic habitat.

Adult_Life_Expectancy.description: Number of days an average mosquito survives. The daily adult mortality rate is 1 / (value of this parameter).

Transmission_Rate.description: Probability of success of an infectious bite on an immunologically naive and uninfected individual, or the modifier of the probability of success for an individual with pre-erythrocytic immunity.

Acquire_Modifier.description: Modifier of the probability of successful infection of a mosquito by a malaria-infected individual, given the individual's infectiousness.

Infectious_Human_Feed_Mortality_Factor.description: Correction factor (dimensionless) used to modify the death rate of mosquitoes when feeding on humans, to account for the increase caused by infections in mosquitoes. Infected mosquitoes have a higher mortality rate while feeding on humans than uninfected mosquitoes.  References: Wekesa J. W., Copeland R. S. , et al. (1992). Effect of Plasmodium Falciparum on Blood Feeding Behavior of Naturally Infected Anopheles Mosquitoes in Western Kenya. Am J Trop Med Hyg 47(4): 484-488.Anderson R. A., Knols B. G. J., et al. (2000). Plasmodium falciparum sporozoites increase feeding-associated mortality of their mosquito hosts Anopheles gambiae s.l. Parasitology 120(04): 329-333.

Indoor_Feeding_Fraction.description: Fraction (dimensionless) of feeds on humans that occur indoors. Thus the fraction of feeds on humans that occur outdoors equals 1 - (value of this parameter).

Nighttime_Feeding_Fraction.description: Fraction (dimensionless) of feeds on humans that occur during the nighttime. Thus the fraction of feeds on humans that occur during the day equals 1 - (value of this parameter).

Max_Drug_IRBC_Kill.description: Maximum log reduction in IRBCs per day.

Drug_Hepatocyte_Killrate.description: Log reduction in hepatocytes per day.

Drug_Gametocyte02_Killrate.description: Log reduction per day in early-stage gametocytes.

Drug_Gametocyte34_Killrate.description: Log reduction per day in late-stage gametocytes.

Drug_GametocyteM_Killrate.description: Log reduction per day in mature gametocytes at saturated drug concentration.

Drug_PKPD_C50.description: Concentration at which drug killing rates are half of maximum. Note: This parameter and the Drug_Cmax parameter must use the same units.

Drug_Cmax.description: Maximum drug concentration in the same units as Drug_PKPD_C50. Note: Since drug concentrations and C50 values are often specified with different unit systems, these two parameters have been designed to be flexible, provided that the units are the same for each.

Drug_Vd.description: Volume of distribution. This value is the ratio of the volume of the second compartment to the volume of the first compartment in a two-compartment model, and is dimensionless.

Drug_Decay_T1.description: Primary drug decay rate, in days.

Drug_Decay_T2.description: Secondary drug decay rate, in days.

Drug_Fulltreatment_Doses.description: Number of doses for a full treatment.

Bodyweight_Exponent.description: Effect of body weight on maximum drug concentration in an individual patient.

Upper_Age_In_Years.description: The age (in years) below which children are given the corresponding fraction of an adult drug dose.

Fraction_Of_Adult_Dose.description: The fraction of an adult drug dose given to children below the corresponding age (in years).

Fractional_Dose_By_Upper_Age.description: An array of doses that contain Upper_Age_In_Years and Fraction_Of_Adult_Dose values.

Simulation_Type.description: Type of disease being simulated. Supported values include GENERIC_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, MALARIA_SIM, TB_SIM, STI_SIM, HIV_SIM, and PY_SIM. To query the values supported for your specific build, use the --version option.

Simulation_Duration.description: Elapsed time noted in days from the start to the end of a simulation.

Simulation_Timestep.description: Value indicating simulation time step in days.

Start_Time.description: Time noted in days when the simulation begins. This time influences the point in the temporal input data, such as where in the climate input the DTK starts running the simulation. Note: The Start_Day of campaign events is in absolute time. So, time relative to the beginning of the simulation depends on this parameter.

Enable_Demographics_Builtin.description: Uses demographics input files to configure the initial population. Enter 0 to use a standard testing sandbox which is useful for testing and validating code pathways.

Default_Geography_Initial_Node_Populatio.description: TBD - When using the default geography (i.e. Enable_Demographics_Builtin = 1), this is the initial number of individuals in each node.

Default_Geography_Torus_Size.description: TBD - When using the default geography (i.e. Enable_Demographics_Builtin = 1), this is the square root of the number of nodes in the simulation.  For migration, the nodes are assumed to be a torus.

Node_Grid_Size.description: Spatial resolution indicating the node grid size for a simulation in degrees.

Migration_Model.description: Model to use for migration. Possible values are: NO_MIGRATION and FIXED_RATE_MIGRATION.

Enable_Interventions.description: Set to 1 to load campaign interventions from file. Set to 0 to run a baseline simulation without campaigns.

Enable_Heterogeneous_Intranode_Transmiss.description: Set to 1 to enable heterogeneous intra-node disease transmission. Requires individual property definitions and beta matrix to be specified. Set to 0 to disable.

Number_Basestrains.description: The number of base strains in the simulation, such as antigenic variants.

Number_Substrains.description: The number of disease substrains for each base strain, such as genetic variants.

Immunity_Initialization_Distribution_Typ.description: Method for initializing the immunity distribution in the simulated population. Possible values are: DISTRIBUTION_OFF - All individuals default to no immunity. DISTRIBUTION_SIMPLE - Individual immunities are drawn from a distribution whose functional form and parameters are specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layers: 'ImmunityDistributionFlag', 'ImmunityDistribution1', and 'ImmunityDistribution2'. DISTRIBUTION_COMPLEX - Individual immnunities are drawn from an age-dependent piecewise linear distribution specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layer 'ImmunityDistribution'.

Serialization_Time_Steps.description: Array of time steps after which to save serialized state. 0 indicates initial state before simulation, n indicates after the nth time step.

Serialized_Population_Path.description: Root path for locating serialized population files.

Serialized_Population_Filenames.description: Array of filenames with serialized population data. Number of filenames must match the number of cores used for simulation.

Simulation_Type.description: Type of disease being simulated. Supported values include GENERIC_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, MALARIA_SIM, TB_SIM, STI_SIM, HIV_SIM, and PY_SIM. To query the values supported for your specific build, use the --version option.

So, time relative to the beginning of the simulation depends on this parameter.

Evolution_Polio_Clock_Type.description: Functional form of the molecular clock for evolution dynamics. Applies to vaccine-derived strains in host. Possible values are: POLIO_EVOCLOCK_NONE, POLIO_EVOCLOCK_LINEAR, POLIO_EVOCLOCK_IMMUNITY, POLIO_EVOCLOCK_REVERSION_AND_IMMUNITY, POLIO_EVOCLOCK_REVERSION

VDPV_Virulence_Model_Type.description: Type of virulence model for fitness gains in reversion of attenuating sites. The selected model controls the effects of evolution or reversion. Possible values are: POLIO_VDPV_NONVIRULENT, POLIO_VDPV_PARALYSIS, POLIO_VDPV_PARALYSIS_AND_LOG_INFECTIVITY, POLIO_VDPV_LOG_PARALYSIS_AND_LOG_INFECTIVITY

Max_Rand_Standard_Deviations.description: Limit to extents of a random normal as number of standard deviations.

Viral_Interference_WPV1.description: Probability that a WPV1 infection in an individual will block infection by any other poliovirus type.

Viral_Interference_WPV2.description: Probability that a WPV2 infection in an individual will block infection by any other poliovirus type.

Viral_Interference_WPV3.description: Probability that a WPV3 infection in an individual will block infection by any other poliovirus type.

Viral_Interference_Sabin1.description: Probability that a Sabin1 infection in an individual will block superinfection by any other poliovirus type.

Viral_Interference_Sabin2.description: Probability that a Sabin2 infection in an individual will block superinfection by any other poliovirus type.

Viral_Interference_Sabin3.description: Probability that a Sabin3 infection in an individual will block superinfection by any other poliovirus type.

Vaccine_Take_Scaling_Sabin1.description: A multiplier to represent vaccine take of live Sabin virus for type 1.

Vaccine_Take_Scaling_Sabin2.description: A multiplier to represent vaccine take of live Sabin virus for type 2.

Vaccine_Take_Scaling_Sabin3.description: A multiplier to represent vaccine take of live Sabin virus for type 3.

Mucosal_Immunogenicity_IPV.description: The mucosal immunogenicity of IPV relative to OPV.

Mucosal_Immunogenicity_IPV_OPVExposed.description: The mucosal immunogenicity of IPV relative to OPV on OPV-exposed individuals.

Neutralization_Time_Tau.description: Virus neutralization time constant in days.

Paralysis_Base_Rate_WPV1.description: Probability of paralysis from a WPV1 poliovirus infection in a fully susceptible individual.

Paralysis_Base_Rate_WPV2.description: Probability of paralysis from a WPV2 poliovirus infection in a fully susceptible individual.

Paralysis_Base_Rate_WPV3.description: Probability of paralysis from a WPV3 poliovirus infection in a fully susceptible individual.

Paralysis_Base_Rate_Sabin1.description: Probability of paralysis (VAPP) from a Sabin1 poliovirus infection in a fully susceptible individual.

Paralysis_Base_Rate_Sabin2.description: Probability of paralysis (VAPP) from a Sabin2 poliovirus infection in a fully susceptible individual.

Paralysis_Base_Rate_Sabin3.description: Probability of paralysis (VAPP) from a Sabin3 poliovirus infection in a fully susceptible individual.

Incubation_Disease_Mu.description: Incubation period to disease, mu parameter, in polio these are interpreted as lognormal

Incubation_Disease_Sigma.description: Incubation period to disease, sigma parameter, in polio these are interpreted as lognormal

Boost_Log2_NAb_OPV1.description: Increase in log2 neutralizing antibody titer in response to Sabin1 infection.

Boost_Log2_NAb_OPV2.description: Increase in log2 neutralizing antibody titer in response to Sabin2 infection.

Boost_Log2_NAb_OPV3.description: Increase in log2 neutralizing antibody titer in response to Sabin3 infection.

Boost_Log2_NAb_IPV1.description: Increase in log2 neutralizing antibody titer in response to IPV1 antigen.

Boost_Log2_NAb_IPV2.description: Increase in log2 neutralizing antibody titer in response to IPV2 antigen.

Boost_Log2_NAb_IPV3.description: Increase in log2 neutralizing antibody titer in response to IPV3 antigen.

Max_Log2_NAb_OPV1.description: Multiplicative factor on the natural log of neutralizing antibody titer in response to live poliovirus challenge for OPV1.

Max_Log2_NAb_OPV2.description: Multiplicative factor on the natural log of neutralizing antibody titer in response to live poliovirus challenge for OPV2.

Max_Log2_NAb_OPV3.description: Multiplicative factor on the natural log of neutralizing antibody titer in response to live poliovirus challenge for OPV3.

Max_Log2_NAb_IPV1.description: Multiplicative factor on the natural log of neutralizing antibody titer in response to live poliovirus challenge for IPV1.

Max_Log2_NAb_IPV2.description: Multiplicative factor on the natural log of neutralizing antibody titer in response to live poliovirus challenge for IPV2.

Max_Log2_NAb_IPV3.description: Multiplicative factor on the natural log of neutralizing antibody titer in response to live poliovirus challenge for IPV3.

Boost_Log2_NAb_Stddev_OPV1.description: Standard deviation in log2 antibody boost for Sabin1 infection.

Boost_Log2_NAb_Stddev_OPV2.description: Standard deviation in log2 antibody boost for Sabin2 infection.

Boost_Log2_NAb_Stddev_OPV3.description: Standard deviation in log2 antibody boost for Sabin3 infection.

Boost_Log2_NAb_Stddev_IPV1.description: Standard deviation in log2 antibody boost for IPV1 antigen.

Boost_Log2_NAb_Stddev_IPV2.description: Standard deviation in log2 antibody boost for IPV2 antigen.

Boost_Log2_NAb_Stddev_IPV3.description: Standard deviation in log2 antibody boost for IPV3 antigen.

Prime_Log2_NAb_OPV1.description: First Sabin1 infection log2 neutralizing antibody titer.

Prime_Log2_NAb_OPV2.description: First Sabin2 infection log2 neutralizing antibody titer.

Prime_Log2_NAb_OPV3.description: First Sabin3 infection log2 neutralizing antibody titer.

Prime_Log2_NAb_IPV1.description: First IPV1 antigen exposure log2 neutralizing antibody titer.

Prime_Log2_NAb_IPV2.description: First IPV2 antigen exposure log2 neutralizing antibody titer.

Prime_Log2_NAb_IPV3.description: First IPV3 antigen exposure log2 neutralizing antibody titer.

Prime_Log2_NAb_Stddev_OPV1.description: Standard deviation in Sabin1 log2 priming titer.

Prime_Log2_NAb_Stddev_OPV2.description: Standard deviation in Sabin2 log2 priming titer.

Prime_Log2_NAb_Stddev_OPV3.description: Standard deviation in Sabin3 log2 priming titer.

Prime_Log2_NAb_Stddev_IPV1.description: Standard deviation in IPV1 log2 priming titer.

Prime_Log2_NAb_Stddev_IPV2.description: Standard deviation in IPV2 log2 priming titer.

Prime_Log2_NAb_Stddev_IPV3.description: Standard deviation in IPV3 log2 priming titer.

Shed_Fecal_MaxLog10_Peak_Titer.description: fecal shedding maximum log10 titer for the peak of shedding profile.

Shed_Fecal_MaxLog10_Peak_Titer_Stddev.description: fecal shedding standatd deviation in log10 titer for the peak of shedding profile.

Shed_Fecal_Titer_Block_Log2NAb.description: mucosal log2 neutralizing antibodies to reduce fecal shedding maximum log10 titer to zero.

Shed_Fecal_Titer_Profile_Mu.description: fecal shedding shape parameter for titer profile.

Shed_Fecal_Titer_Profile_Sigma.description: fecal sheding shape parameter for titer profile.

Shed_Fecal_MaxLn_Duration.description: fecal shedding natural log of maximum infection duration.

Shed_Fecal_MaxLn_Duration_Stddev.description: fecal shedding standard deviation in natural log of infection duration.

Shed_Fecal_Duration_Block_Log2NAb.description: mucosal log2 neutralizing antibodies to reduce fecal shedding duration to zero.

Shed_Oral_MaxLog10_Peak_Titer.description: fecal shedding maximum log10 titer for the peak of shedding profile.

Shed_Oral_MaxLog10_Peak_Titer_Stddev.description: fecal shedding standatd deviation in log10 titer for the peak of shedding profile.

Shed_Oral_Titer_Block_Log2NAb.description: mucosal log2 neutralizing antibodies to reduce fecal shedding maximum log10 titer to zero.

Shed_Oral_Titer_Profile_Mu.description: fecal shedding shape parameter for titer profile.

Shed_Oral_Titer_Profile_Sigma.description: fecal sheding shape parameter for titer profile.

Shed_Oral_MaxLn_Duration.description: fecal shedding natural log of maximum infection duration.

Shed_Oral_MaxLn_Duration_Stddev.description: fecal shedding standard deviation in natural log of infection duration.

Shed_Oral_Duration_Block_Log2NAb.description: mucosal log2 neutralizing antibodies to reduce fecal shedding duration to zero.

Maternal_log2NAb_mean.description: mean of log2 neutralizing antibodies in mothers

Maternal_log2NAb_std.description: std deviation of log2 neutralizing antibodies in mothers

Maternal_Ab_Halflife.description: half life in days for maternal neutralizing antibodies

Vaccine_Titer_tOPV2.description: Trivalent OPV titer in TCID50 per dose of type 2 component.

Vaccine_Titer_tOPV3.description: Trivalent OPV titer in TCID50 per dose of type 3 component.

Vaccine_Titer_bOPV1.description: Bivalent OPV titer in TCID50 per dose of type 1 component.

Vaccine_Titer_bOPV3.description: Bivalent OPV titer in TCID50 per dose of type 3 component.

Vaccine_Titer_mOPV1.description: Monovalent OPV type 1 titer in TCID50 per dose.

Vaccine_Titer_mOPV2.description: Monovalent OPV type 2 titer in TCID50 per dose.

Vaccine_Titer_mOPV3.description: Monovalent OPV type 3 titer in TCID50 per dose.

Vaccine_Dantigen_IPV2.description: Potency of inactivated polio vaccine, in D-antigen units, for serotype 2 component.

Vaccine_Dantigen_IPV3.description: Potency of inactivated polio vaccine, in D-antigen units, for serotype 3 component.

Reversion_Steps_Sabin1.description: Number of attenuating sites for Sabin1.

Reversion_Steps_Sabin2.description: Number of attenuating sites for Sabin2.

Reversion_Steps_Sabin3.description: Number of attenuating sites for Sabin3.

TB_Drug_Types_For_This_Sim.description: The list of drug types that will be used with the AntiTBPropDep intervention. The values for the drug are defined by TB_Drug_Params.

TB_Drug_Inactivation_Rate.description: This parameter, TB_Drug_Cure_Rate, TB_Drug_Relapse_Rate, and TB_Drug_Mortality_Rate, specify the daily probability of a change in the TB disease state during the course of treatment. The sum of these rates and the total duration of treatment specify the probability that any event occurs. If no event occurs, the individual fails drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Cure_Rate.description: This parameter, TB_Drug_Inactivation, TB_Drug_Relapse_Rate, and TB_Drug_Mortality_Rate specify the daily probability of a change in the TB disease state during the course of treatment. The sum of these rates and the total duration of treatment specify the probability that any event occurs. If no event occurs, the individual fails drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Resistance_Rate.description: This parameter determines the daily probability that an (HIV-) individual with drug-sensitive TB will acquire MDR-TB. Only individuals who return to the latent state or fail can acquire MDR-TB.

TB_Drug_Relapse_Rate.description: This parameter, TB_Drug_Inactivation, TB_Drug_Cure_Rate, and TB_Drug_Mortality_Rate specify the daily probability of a change in the TB disease state during the course of treatment. The sum of these rates and the total duration of treatment specify the probability that any event occurs. If no event occurs, the individual fails drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Mortality_Rate.description: This parameter, TB_Drug_Inactivation, TB_Drug_Relapse_Rate, and TB_Drug_Cure_Rate specify the daily probability of a change in the TB disease state during the course of treatment. The sum of these rates and the total duration of treatment specify the probability that any event occurs. If no event occurs, the individual fails drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Primary_Decay_Time_Constant.description: The primary decay time constant of the decay profile.

Simulation_Type.description: Type of disease being simulated. Supported values include GENERIC_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, MALARIA_SIM, TB_SIM, STI_SIM, HIV_SIM, and PY_SIM. To query the values supported for your specific build, use the --version option.

Default_Geography_Initial_Node_Populatio.description: TBD - When using the default geography (i.e. Enable_Demographics_Builtin = 1), this is the initial number of individuals in each node.

Default_Geography_Torus_Size.description: TBD - When using the default geography (i.e. Enable_Demographics_Builtin = 1), this is the square root of the number of nodes in the simulation.  For migration, the nodes are assumed to be a torus.

Node_Grid_Size.description: Spatial resolution indicating the node grid size for a simulation in degrees.

Migration_Model.description: Model to use for migration. Possible values are: NO_MIGRATION and FIXED_RATE_MIGRATION.

Enable_Interventions.description: Set to 1 to load campaign interventions from file. Set to 0 to run a baseline simulation without campaigns.

Enable_Heterogeneous_Intranode_Transmiss.description: Set to 1 to enable heterogeneous intra-node disease transmission. Requires individual property definitions and beta matrix to be specified. Set to 0 to disable.

Number_Basestrains.description: The number of base strains in the simulation, such as antigenic variants.

Number_Substrains.description: The number of disease substrains for each base strain, such as genetic variants.

Immunity_Initialization_Distribution_Typ.description: Method for initializing the immunity distribution in the simulated population. Possible values are: DISTRIBUTION_OFF - All individuals default to no immunity. DISTRIBUTION_SIMPLE - Individual immunities are drawn from a distribution whose functional form and parameters are specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layers: 'ImmunityDistributionFlag', 'ImmunityDistribution1', and 'ImmunityDistribution2'. DISTRIBUTION_COMPLEX - Individual immnunities are drawn from an age-dependent piecewise linear distribution specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layer 'ImmunityDistribution'.

CD4_Time_Step.description: Length of steps in CD4 longitudinal tracker

Num_CD4_Time_Steps.description: Number of time steps in CD4 forward vector for reactivation

TBHIV_Drug_Types.description: The list of drug types that will be used with the AntiTBPropDep intervention. The values for the drug are defined by TB_Drug_Params.

Serialization_Time_Steps.description: Array of time steps after which to save serialized state. 0 indicates initial state before simulation, n indicates after the nth time step.

Serialized_Population_Path.description: Root path for locating serialized population files.

Serialized_Population_Filenames.description: Array of filenames with serialized population data. Number of filenames must match the number of cores used for simulation.

TB_Drug_Inactivation_Rate.description: This parameter, TB_Drug_Cure_Rate, TB_Drug_Relapse_Rate, and TB_Drug_Mortality_Rate, specify the daily probability of a change in the TB disease state during the course of treatment. The sum of these rates and the total duration of treatment specify the probability that any event occurs. If no event occurs, the individual fails drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Cure_Rate.description: This parameter, TB_Drug_Inactivation, TB_Drug_Relapse_Rate, and TB_Drug_Mortality_Rate specify the daily probability of a change in the TB disease state during the course of treatment. The sum of these rates and the total duration of treatment specify the probability that any event occurs. If no event occurs, the individual fails drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Resistance_Rate.description: This parameter determines the daily probability that an (HIV-) individual with drug-sensitive TB will acquire MDR-TB. Only individuals who return to the latent state or fail can acquire MDR-TB.

TB_Drug_Relapse_Rate.description: This parameter, TB_Drug_Inactivation, TB_Drug_Cure_Rate, and TB_Drug_Mortality_Rate specify the daily probability of a change in the TB disease state during the course of treatment. The sum of these rates and the total duration of treatment specify the probability that any event occurs. If no event occurs, the individual fails drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Mortality_Rate.description: This parameter, TB_Drug_Inactivation, TB_Drug_Relapse_Rate, and TB_Drug_Cure_Rate specify the daily probability of a change in the TB disease state during the course of treatment. The sum of these rates and the total duration of treatment specify the probability that any event occurs. If no event occurs, the individual fails drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Primary_Decay_Time_Constant.description: The primary decay time constant of the decay profile.

TB_Drug_Inactivation_Rate_HIV.description: Daily probability of active drug sensitive TB infection becoming latent in HIV+ person under drug treatment

TB_Drug_Inactivation_Rate_MDR.description: Daily probability of active MDR infection becoming latent in HIV+ or HIV-  person under drug treatment

TB_Drug_Cure_Rate_HIV.description: Daily probability of active TB infection clearing in HIV+ person under drug treatment

TB_Drug_Cure_Rate_MDR.description: Daily probability of active MDR infection clearning in HIV+ or HIV- person under drug treatment

TB_Drug_Resistance_Rate_HIV.description: This parameter determines the daily probability that an (HIV+) individual with drug-sensitive TB will acquire MDR-TB. Only individuals who return to the latent state or fail can acquire MDR-TB.

TB_Drug_Relapse_Rate_MDR.description: Determines the proportion of relapsers among active MDR TB infections under drug treatment. The parameter represents the daily probability that an MDR active infection (in HIV+ or HIV-) will inactivate but subsequently relapse in a time frame defined by the Relapse_Rate

TB_Drug_Relapse_Rate_HIV.description: Determines the proportion of relapsers among HIV+ with active drug sensitive infections under drug treatment. The parameter represents the daily probability that a drug sensitive active infection in HIV+ will inactivate but subsequently relapse in a time frame defined by the Relapse_Rate

TB_Drug_Mortality_Rate_MDR.description: Daily probability of death for individual with MDR active infection under drug treatment

TB_Drug_Mortality_Rate_HIV.description: Daily probability of death for HIV+ individual with drug sensitive active infection under drug treatment

TB_Reduced_Transmit.description: Proportion reduction in TB transission under drug treatment

TB_Reduced_Acquire.description: Proportion reduction in acquisition of new TB infection under drug treatment. Only relevant when TB_Enable_Exogenous is enabled to allow exogenous re-infection

Simulation_Type.description: Type of disease being simulated. Supported values include GENERIC_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, MALARIA_SIM, TB_SIM, STI_SIM, HIV_SIM, and PY_SIM. To query the values supported for your specific build, use the --version option.

Simulation_Timestep.description: Value indicating simulation time step in days.

Number_Substrains.description: The number of disease substrains for each base strain, such as genetic variants.

Possible values are: DISTRIBUTION_OFF - All individuals default to no immunity. DISTRIBUTION_SIMPLE - Individual immunities are drawn from a distribution whose functional form and parameters are specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layers: 'ImmunityDistributionFlag', 'ImmunityDistribution1', and 'ImmunityDistribution2'. Vector_Sampling_Type.description: Type of vector module used in a simulation. Possible values are: TRACK_ALL_VECTORS, SAMPLE_IND_VECTORS, VECTOR_COMPARTMENTS_NUMBER and VECTOR_COMPARTMENTS_PERCENT.

Egg_Hatch_Delay_Distribution.description: Is there a delay in egg hatching from oviposition? If so, how is that delay distributed? Possible values are: NO_DELAY and EXPONENTIAL_DURATION.

Egg_Saturation_At_Oviposition.description: Is there saturation in the number of viable eggs at oviposition depending on available larval habitat? Possible values are: NO_SATURATION and SATURATION_AT_OVIPOSITION.

Larval_Density_Dependence.description: Set to UNIFORM_WHEN_OVERPOPULATION to apply mortality uniformly to all larvae when the population exceeds the specified carrying capacity for that habitat. Set to GRADUAL_INSTAR_SPECIFIC to apply mortality and delayed growth in an instar-specific fashion where the younger larvae are more susceptible to predation and competition from older larvae. The LARVAL_AGE_DENSITY_DEPENDENT_MORTALITY_ONLY and DENSITY_DELAYED_GROWTH_NOT_MORTALITY options configure only the age-dependent mortality componenent or only the delayed-growth component, respectively. For the NO_DENSITY_DEPENDENCE option, there is no additional larval density-dependent mortality factor. Possible values are: UNIFORM_WHEN_OVERPOPULATION, GRADUAL_INSTAR_SPECIFIC, LARVAL_AGE_DENSITY_DEPENDENT_MORTALITY_ONLY, DENSITY_DELAYED_GROWTH_NOT_MORTALITY, NO_DENSITY_DEPENDENCE.

Egg_Hatch_Density_Dependence.description: If set to true, egg hatching is delayed as a function of larval density, similar to larval_density_dependence. Possbile values are: DENSITY_DEPENDENCE and NO_DENSITY_DEPENDENCE.

Vector_Sugar_Feeding_Frequency.description: How often does a female mosquito take a sugar feed? Possible values are: VECTOR_SUGAR_FEEDING_NONE - No sugar feeding. VECTOR_SUGAR_FEEDING_ON_EMERGENCE_ONLY - Sugar feeding once at emergence. VECTOR_SUGAR_FEEDING_EVERY_FEED - Sugar feeding occurs once per blood meal. VECTOR_SUGAR_FEEDING_EVERY_DAY - Sugar feeding occurs everyday. Note: This parameter is used in conjunction with the SugarTrap and OvipositionTrap interventions. These features require Vector_Sampling_Type to be set to TRACK_ALL_VECTORS or SAMPLE_IND_VECTORS.

Vector_Larval_Rainfall_Mortality.description: Type of vector larval mortality function due to rainfall.  Possible values are NONE, SIGMOID, where the mortality rate grows linearly from 0 at the threshold to 1 at twice the threshold value, and SIGMOID_HABITAT_SHIFTING, where the threshold value is reduced by a factor proportional to how full the larval habitat is.

Larval_Rainfall_Mortality_Threshold.description: The threshold value on daily rainfall in millimeters, above which larval mortality is applied when Vector_Larval_Rainfall_Mortality is set to either SIGMOID or SIGMOID_HABITAT_SHIFTING.

Enable_Temperature_Dependent_Egg_Hatchin.description: Set to 1 to include a temperature effect on egg hatching, defined by Egg_arrhenius 1 & 2.

Egg_Arrhenius1.description: First parameter that defines the temperature dependent egg hatching

Egg_Arrhenius2.description: Second parameter that defines the temperature dependent egg hatching

Enable_Egg_Mortality.description: Set to 1 to include a daily mortality rate on the egg population, defined by 1 - Egg_Survival_Rate

Drought_Egg_Hatch_Delay.description: Proportion of regular egg hatching that still occurs when habitat dries up.

Larval_Density_Mortality_Scalar.description: A scale factor in the formula determining the larval-age-dependent mortality for the GRADUAL_INSTAR_SPECIFIC and LARVAL_AGE_DENSITY_DEPENDENT_MORTALITY_ONLY models.

Larval_Density_Mortality_Offset.description: An offset factor in the formula determining the larval-age-dependent mortality for the GRADUAL_INSTAR_SPECIFIC and LARVAL_AGE_DENSITY_DEPENDENT_MORTALITY_ONLY models.

HEG_Model.description: An enum governing the homing endonuclease gene (HEG) dynamics. Possible values are: OFF, GERMLINE_HOMING (early), EGG_HOMING (late).

HEG_Homing_Rate.description: The fractional redistribution from heterozygous offspring to the homozygous homing-endonuclease-gene (HEG) behavior.

HEG_Fecundity_Limiting.description: The fractional reduction in the number of eggs laid by a female mosquito who is homozygous in the homing endonuclease gene (HEG).

Enable_Vector_Aging.description: Set to 1 to simulate vector senescence. Set to 0 to assume that vector behavior does not change with age.

Temperature_Dependent_Feeding_Cycle.description: Set to ARRHENIUS_DEPENDENCE or BOUNDED_DEPENDENCE to have the duration between blood-feeds depend on the temperature. Option 1 follows the arrhenius equation with parameters cycle_arrhenius 1 and 2. Option 2 follows an equation bounded at 10 days at 15 degrees celcius and use 'Days_Between_Feeds' to set the duration at 30 degrees Celsius.  Otherwise, if set to NO_TEMPERATURE_DEPENDENCE, days between feeds will be constant and specified by the parameter 'Days_Between_Feeds' for each species.

Mean_Egg_Hatch_Delay.description: Mean delay in egg hatch time noted in days from the time of oviposition.

Wolbachia_Mortality_Modification.description: The change in vector mortality due to a Wolbachia infection.

Wolbachia_Infection_Modification.description: The change in vector susceptibility to infection due to a Wolbachia infection.

Human_Feeding_Mortality.description: Fraction (dimensionless) of mosquitoes that die while feeding on a human. As of version 1.5, this is now a one-value-per-simulation quantity.

Temporary_Habitat_Decay_Factor.description: Factor to convert raw evaporation rate (ignoring boundary layer effects) to the daily rate of larval habitat loss for temporary habitats with Habitat_Type parameter of TEMPORARY_RAINFALL.  Units are (larval carrying capacity per day) / (kg per square meter per second).

Semipermanent_Habitat_Decay_Rate.description: Daily rate of larval habitat loss for semi-permanent habitats with Habitat_Type parameter of WATER_VEGETATION or BRACKISH_SWAMP.

Rainfall_In_mm_To_Fill_Swamp.description: Millimeters of rain to fill larval habitat to capacity. Only used for vector species with Habitat_Type set to BRACKISH_SWAMP.

x_Temporary_Larval_Habitat.description: Scales the habitat size for all mosquito populations.

Vector_Species_Names.description: An array of vector species names for all species that are present in the simulation. For example, ['arabiensis', 'funestus', 'gambiae'].

Serialization_Time_Steps.description: Array of time steps after which to save serialized state. 0 indicates initial state before simulation, n indicates after the nth time step.

Serialized_Population_Path.description: Root path for locating serialized population files.

Serialized_Population_Filenames.description: Array of filenames with serialized population data. Number of filenames must match the number of cores used for simulation.

Larval_Habitat_Types.description: A measure of the habitat type and scaling factors to use to estimate larval population. You can specify this with a dictionary specifying habitat type with a simple numeric scaling factor or, for LINEAR_SPLINE, with a more detailed configuration for scaling. Possible habitat values are: CONSTANT TEMPORARY_RAINFALL WATER_VEGETATION HUMAN_POPULATION BRACKISH_SWAMP LINEAR_SPLINE.

Aquatic_Arrhenius_1.description: The duration of aquatic development is a decreasing function of temperature.  The daily rate of fractional progression from egg-hatching to emergence is parameterized by the Arrhenius equation, a1 * exp( -a2 / T ), with T in degrees Kelvin.  This parameter, a1, is a temperature-independent scale factor on the development rate.  Reference: Craig M.H., Snow R.W., et al. (1999). A climate-based distribution model of malaria transmission in sub-Saharan Africa. Parasitology Today 15(3) 105-111.

Aquatic_Arrhenius_2.description: The duration of aquatic development is a decreasing function of temperature.  The daily rate of fractional progression from egg-hatching to emergence is parameterized by the Arrhenius equation, a1 * exp( -a2 / T ), with T in degrees Kelvin.   This parameter, a2, governs how quickly the rate changes with temperature. Reference: Craig M.H., Snow R.W., et al. (1999). A climate-based distribution model of malaria transmission in sub-Saharan Africa. Parasitology Today 15(3) 105-111.

Infected_Arrhenius_1.description: The duration of sporogony is a decreasing function of temperature.  The daily rate of fractional progression of infected mosquitoes to an infectious state is parameterized by the Arrhenius equation, a1 * exp( -a2 / T ), with T in degrees Kelvin.   This parameter, a1, is a temperature-independent scale factor on the development rate.  Reference: Craig M.H., Snow R.W., et al. (1999). A climate-based distribution model of malaria transmission in sub-Saharan Africa. Parasitology Today 15(3) 105-111.

Infected_Arrhenius_2.description: The duration of sporogony is a decreasing function of temperature.  The daily rate of fractional progression of infected mosquitoes to an infectious state is parameterized by the Arrhenius equation, a1 * exp( -a2 / T ), with T in degrees Kelvin.   This parameter, a2, governs how quickly the rate changes with temperature.   Reference: Craig M.H., Snow R.W., et al. (1999). A climate-based distribution model of malaria transmission in sub-Saharan Africa. Parasitology Today 15(3) 105-111.

Cycle_Arrhenius_1.description: The duration of the feeding cycle is a decreasing function of temperature.  The daily rate is parameterized by the Arrhenius equation, a1 * exp( -a2 / T ), with T in degrees Kelvin.  This parameter, a1, is a temperature-independent scale factor on the rate at which a mosquito goes through is feeding cycle. Focks, D. A., et al. Dynamic life table model for Aedes aegypti (Diptera: Culicidae): simulation results and validation. Journal of Medical Entomology30.6 (1993): 1018-1028.

Cycle_Arrhenius_2.description: The duration of the feeding cycle is a decreasing function of temperature.  The daily rate is parameterized by the Arrhenius equation, a1 * exp( -a2 / T ), with T in degrees Kelvin.  This parameter, a2, governs how quickly the rate changes with temperature.  Reference: Focks, D. A., et al. Dynamic life table model for Aedes aegypti (Diptera: Culicidae): simulation results and validation. Journal of Medical Entomology30.6 (1993): 1018-1028.

Cycle_Arrhenius_Reduction_Factor.description: The duration of subsequent cycles, from oviposition to oviposition, is shorter because primary follicles are at stage II following oviposition rather than I in the case of newly emerged females.  Reference: Focks, D. A., et al. Dynamic life table model for Aedes aegypti (Diptera: Culicidae): simulation results and validation. Journal of Medical Entomology30.6 (1993): 1018-1028.

Immature_Duration.description: Factor (in days) used to calculate the rate at which immature organisms develop into adult mosquitoes, which equals 1 / (value of this parameter). Note that development from immature individual to adult is not dependent on temperature.

Days_Between_Feeds.description: Factor (in days) used to calculate the rate at which female mosquitoes attempt to feed. The rate equals 1 / (value of this parameter). The Days_Between_Feeds parameter represents a 3-day feeding cycle at normal tropical temperatures (30 C). If it is colder, the cycle is 4 days at 24 C, and if the temperature is warmer, the cycle is shorter, increasing the fraction of 2-day cycles from 30 C to 48 C. Whole temperature-dependent distribution can be shifted by changing Days_Between_Feeds which is always the value at 30 C. See Enable_Temperature_Dependent_Feeding_Cycle for weather-dependent feeding.

Anthropophily.description: Propensity (dimensionless) of the mosquito to feed on humans instead of animals, measured as a fraction of blood meals from human hosts. This propensity is important in differentiating the mosquito species.

Egg_Batch_Size.description: Size of egg batch laid by one female mosquito that has fed successfully.

Infected_Egg_Batch_Factor.description: Factor (dimensionless) used to modify egg batch size to account for effects of infection in a female mosquito. Female mosquitoes undergoing sporogony have reduced fertility.

Aquatic_Mortality_Rate.description: Base aquatic mortality per day for the species before adjustment for effects of overpopulation and drying. The rate is locally adjusted for other considerations, including overpopulation and drying out of the aquatic habitat.

Adult_Life_Expectancy.description: Number of days an average mosquito survives. The daily adult mortality rate is 1 / (value of this parameter).

Transmission_Rate.description: Probability of success of an infectious bite on an immunologically naive and uninfected individual, or the modifier of the probability of success for an individual with pre-erythrocytic immunity.

Acquire_Modifier.description: Modifier of the probability of successful infection of a mosquito by a malaria-infected individual, given the individual's infectiousness.

Infectious_Human_Feed_Mortality_Factor.description: Correction factor (dimensionless) used to modify the death rate of mosquitoes when feeding on humans, to account for the increase caused by infections in mosquitoes. Infected mosquitoes have a higher mortality rate while feeding on humans than uninfected mosquitoes.  References: Wekesa J. W., Copeland R. S. , et al. (1992). Effect of Plasmodium Falciparum on Blood Feeding Behavior of Naturally Infected Anopheles Mosquitoes in Western Kenya. Am J Trop Med Hyg 47(4): 484-488.Anderson R. A., Knols B. G. J., et al. (2000). Plasmodium falciparum sporozoites increase feeding-associated mortality of their mosquito hosts Anopheles gambiae s.l. Parasitology 120(04): 329-333.

Indoor_Feeding_Fraction.description: Fraction (dimensionless) of feeds on humans that occur indoors. Thus the fraction of feeds on humans that occur outdoors equals 1 - (value of this parameter).

Nighttime_Feeding_Fraction.description: Fraction (dimensionless) of feeds on humans that occur during the nighttime. Thus the fraction of feeds on humans that occur during the day equals 1 - (value of this parameter).

Number_Substrains.description: The number of disease substrains for each base strain, such as genetic variants.

Immunity_Initialization_Distribution_Typ.description: Method for initializing the immunity distribution in the simulated population. Possible values are: DISTRIBUTION_OFF - All individuals default to no immunity. DISTRIBUTION_SIMPLE - Individual immunities are drawn from a distribution whose functional form and parameters are specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layers: 'ImmunityDistributionFlag', 'ImmunityDistribution1', and 'ImmunityDistribution2'. DISTRIBUTION_COMPLEX - Individual immnunities are drawn from an age-dependent piecewise linear distribution specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layer 'ImmunityDistribution'.

Serialization_Time_Steps.description: Array of time steps after which to save serialized state. 0 indicates initial state before simulation, n indicates after the nth time step.

Serialized_Population_Path.description: Root path for locating serialized population files.

Serialized_Population_Filenames.description: Array of filenames with serialized population data. Number of filenames must match the number of cores used for simulation.

Simulation_Type.description: Type of disease being simulated. Supported values include GENERIC_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, MALARIA_SIM, TB_SIM, STI_SIM, HIV_SIM, and PY_SIM. To query the values supported for your specific build, use the --version option.

Simulation_Duration.description: Elapsed time noted in days from the start to the end of a simulation.

Simulation_Timestep.description: Value indicating simulation time step in days.

Start_Time.description: Time noted in days when the simulation begins. This time influences the point in the temporal input data, such as where in the climate input the DTK starts running the simulation. Note: The Start_Day of campaign events is in absolute time. So, time relative to the beginning of the simulation depends on this parameter.

Enable_Demographics_Builtin.description: Uses demographics input files to configure the initial population. Enter 0 to use a standard testing sandbox which is useful for testing and validating code pathways.

Default_Geography_Initial_Node_Populatio.description: TBD - When using the default geography (i.e. Enable_Demographics_Builtin = 1), this is the initial number of individuals in each node.

Default_Geography_Torus_Size.description: TBD - When using the default geography (i.e. Enable_Demographics_Builtin = 1), this is the square root of the number of nodes in the simulation.  For migration, the nodes are assumed to be a torus.

Node_Grid_Size.description: Spatial resolution indicating the node grid size for a simulation in degrees.

Migration_Model.description: Model to use for migration. Possible values are: NO_MIGRATION and FIXED_RATE_MIGRATION.

Enable_Interventions.description: Set to 1 to load campaign interventions from file. Set to 0 to run a baseline simulation without campaigns.

Enable_Heterogeneous_Intranode_Transmiss.description: Set to 1 to enable heterogeneous intra-node disease transmission. Requires individual property definitions and beta matrix to be specified. Set to 0 to disable.

Number_Basestrains.description: The number of base strains in the simulation, such as antigenic variants.

Number_Substrains.description: The number of disease substrains for each base strain, such as genetic variants.

Possible values are: DISTRIBUTION_OFF - All individuals default to no immunity. DISTRIBUTION_SIMPLE - Individual immunities are drawn from a distribution whose functional form and parameters are specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layers: 'ImmunityDistributionFlag', 'ImmunityDistribution1', and 'ImmunityDistribution2'. DISTRIBUTION_COMPLEX - Individual immnunities are drawn from an age-dependent piecewise linear distribution specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layer 'ImmunityDistribution'.

DISTRIBUTION_COMPLEX - Individual immnunities are drawn from an age-dependent piecewise linear distribution specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layer 'ImmunityDistribution'.
