Serialized_Population_Path.description: Root path for locating serialized population files.

Serialized_Population_Filenames.description: Array of filenames with serialized population data. Number of filenames must match the number of cores used for simulation.

Air_Temperature_Offset.description: The linear shift of air temperature in degrees Celsius. This is only used or needed when Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Land_Temperature_Offset.description: The linear shift of land surface temperature in degrees Celsius. This is only used or needed when Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Rainfall_Scale_Factor.description: The scalar used in multiplying rainfall value(s). This is only used or needed when Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Relative_Humidity_Scale_Factor.description: The scalar used in multiplying relative humidity value(s). This is only used or needed when Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Enable_Climate_Stochasticity.description: Controls overall stochasticity for climate. Use value 0 to disable all additional climate stochasticity. Use value 1 to enable additional variation as specified by the parameters: Air_Temperature_Variance, Land_Temperature_Variance, Enable_Rainfall_Stochasticity and Relative_Humidity_Variance.

Air_Temperature_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in degrees Celsius) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily air temperature values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.  Only used if the Enable_Climate_Stochasticity is set to 1.

Land_Temperature_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in degrees Celsius) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily land temperature values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.  Only used if the Enable_Climate_Stochasticity is set to 1.

Enable_Rainfall_Stochasticity.description: Set to 0 to disable rainfall stochasticity.  Set to 1 to enable stochastic variation of rainfall drawn from an exponential distribution (with a mean value as the daily rainfall from the Climate_Model values, CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA).

Relative_Humidity_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in percentage, %) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily relative humidity values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.  Only used if the Enable_Climate_Stochasticity is set to 1.

Base_Air_Temperature.description: The value of air temperature where Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_CONSTANT.

Base_Land_Temperature.description: The value of land temperature where Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_CONSTANT.

Base_Rainfall.description: The value of rainfall per day in mm when Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_CONSTANT.

Base_Relative_Humidity.description: The value of humidity where Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_CONSTANT.

Enable_Climate_Stochasticity.description: Controls overall stochasticity for climate. Use value 0 to disable all additional climate stochasticity. Use value 1 to enable additional variation as specified by the parameters: Air_Temperature_Variance, Land_Temperature_Variance, Enable_Rainfall_Stochasticity and Relative_Humidity_Variance.

Air_Temperature_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in degrees Celsius) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily air temperature values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.  Only used if the Enable_Climate_Stochasticity is set to 1.

Land_Temperature_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in degrees Celsius) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily land temperature values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.  Only used if the Enable_Climate_Stochasticity is set to 1.

Enable_Rainfall_Stochasticity.description: Set to 0 to disable rainfall stochasticity.  Set to 1 to enable stochastic variation of rainfall drawn from an exponential distribution (with a mean value as the daily rainfall from the Climate_Model values, CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA).

Relative_Humidity_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in percentage, %) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily relative humidity values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.  Only used if the Enable_Climate_Stochasticity is set to 1.

Climate_Model.description: Determines how the climate of a simulation is configured and from what file(s). Possible values are: CLIMATE_OFF, CLIMATE_CONSTANT - Uses the conditional parameters that give the fixed values of temperature or rain for land temperature, air temperature, rainfall and humidity. CLIMATE_KOPPEN - Uses an input file that decodes Koppen codes by geographic location. CLIMATE_BY_DATA - Reads everything out of several input files with additional parameters that allow the addition of stochasticity or scale offsets.

Climate_Update_Resolution.description: Update resolution for data in climate files. Possible values are: CLIMATE_UPDATE_YEAR, CLIMATE_UPDATE_MONTH, CLIMATE_UPDATE_WEEK, CLIMATE_UPDATE_DAY and CLIMATE_UPDATE_HOUR.

Air_Temperature_Filename.description: Path of input file defining air temperature data measured 2 meters above ground. Relevant only if Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Land_Temperature_Filename.description: Path of input file defining temperature data measured at land surface. Relevant only if Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Rainfall_Filename.description: Path of input file defining rainfall data. Relevant only if Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Relative_Humidity_Filename.description: Path of input file defining relative humidity data measured 2 meters above ground. Relevant only if Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Koppen_Filename.description: Path to input file used to specify Koppen climate classifications. This is only used or needed when Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_KOPPEN.

Enable_Climate_Stochasticity.description: Controls overall stochasticity for climate. Use value 0 to disable all additional climate stochasticity. Use value 1 to enable additional variation as specified by the parameters: Air_Temperature_Variance, Land_Temperature_Variance, Enable_Rainfall_Stochasticity and Relative_Humidity_Variance.

Air_Temperature_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in degrees Celsius) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily air temperature values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.  Only used if the Enable_Climate_Stochasticity is set to 1.

Land_Temperature_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in degrees Celsius) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily land temperature values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.  Only used if the Enable_Climate_Stochasticity is set to 1.

Enable_Rainfall_Stochasticity.description: Set to 0 to disable rainfall stochasticity.  Set to 1 to enable stochastic variation of rainfall drawn from an exponential distribution (with a mean value as the daily rainfall from the Climate_Model values, CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA).

Relative_Humidity_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in percentage, %) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily relative humidity values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.  Only used if the Enable_Climate_Stochasticity is set to 1.

Infectiousness_Asymptomatic_Naive_1.description: Determines infectiousness over time for primarily infected asymptomatic individuals. This is c1 in f ( x ) = exp( - c1 * ( x - c2 ) ^ 2 ) / c3. Function is parameterized using viremia estimates from Clapham, Hannah E., et al. Within-host viral dynamics of dengue serotype 1 infection. Journal of The Royal Society Interface 11.96 (2014): 20140094. and the relation infectiousness to viremia comes from Duong, Veasna, et al. Asymptomatic humans transmit dengue virus to mosquitoes. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences 112.47 (2015): 14688-14693. See ten Bosch et al. 2016 for details on this analysis

Infectiousness_Asymptomatic_Naive_2.description: Determines infectiousness over time for primarily infected asymptomatic individuals. This is c2 in f ( x ) = exp( - c1 * ( x - c2 ) ^ 2 ) / c3. see Infectiousness_Asymptomatic_Naive_1_DESC_TEXT for sources

Infectiousness_Asymptomatic_Naive_3.description: Determines infectiousness over time for primarily infected asymptomatic individuals. This is c3 in f ( x ) = exp( - c1 * ( x - c2 ) ^ 2 ) / c3. see Infectiousness_Asymptomatic_Naive_1_DESC_TEXT for sources

Infectiousness_Asymptomatic_Reinfected_1.description: Determines infectiousness over time for (post)secondarily infected asymptomatic individuals. This is c1 in f ( x ) = exp( - c1 * ( x - c2 ) ^ 2 ) / c3. see Infectiousness_Asymptomatic_Naive_1_DESC_TEXT for sources

Infectiousness_Asymptomatic_Reinfected_2.description: Determines infectiousness over time for (post)secondarily infected asymptomatic individuals. This is c2 in f ( x ) = exp( - c1 * ( x - c2 ) ^ 2 ) / c3. see Infectiousness_Asymptomatic_Naive_1_DESC_TEXT for sources

Infectiousness_Asymptomatic_Reinfected_3.description: Determines infectiousness over time for (post)secondarily infected asymptomatic individuals. This is c3 in f ( x ) = exp( - c1 * ( x - c2 ) ^ 2 ) / c3. see Infectiousness_Asymptomatic_Naive_1_DESC_TEXT for sources

Infectiousness_Symptomatic_Naive_1.description: Determines infectiousness over time for primarily infected symptomatic individuals. This is c1 in f ( x ) = exp( - c1 * ( x - c2 ) ^ 2 ) / c3. see Infectiousness_Asymptomatic_Naive_1_DESC_TEXT for sources

Infectiousness_Symptomatic_Naive_2.description: Determines infectiousness over time for primarily infected symptomatic individuals. This is c2 in f ( x ) = exp( - c1 * ( x - c2 ) ^ 2 ) / c3. see Infectiousness_Asymptomatic_Naive_1_DESC_TEXT for sources

Infectiousness_Symptomatic_Naive_3.description: Determines infectiousness over time for primarily infected symptomatic individuals. This is c3 in f ( x ) = exp( - c1 * ( x - c2 ) ^ 2 ) / c3. see Infectiousness_Asymptomatic_Naive_1_DESC_TEXT for sources

Infectiousness_Symptomatic_Reinfected_1.description: Determines infectiousness over time for (post)secondarily infected symptomatic individuals. This is c1 in f ( x ) = exp( - c1 * ( x - c2 ) ^ 2 ) / c3. see Infectiousness_Asymptomatic_Naive_1_DESC_TEXT for sources

Infectiousness_Symptomatic_Reinfected_2.description: Determines infectiousness over time for (post)secondarily infected symptomatic individuals. This is c2 in f ( x ) = exp( - c1 * ( x - c2 ) ^ 2 ) / c3. see Infectiousness_Asymptomatic_Naive_1_DESC_TEXT for sources

Infectiousness_Symptomatic_Reinfected_3.description: Determines infectiousness over time for (post)secondarily infected symptomatic individuals. This is c3 in f ( x ) = exp( - c1 * ( x - c2 ) ^ 2 ) / c3. see Infectiousness_Asymptomatic_Naive_1_DESC_TEXT for sources

Strain1_Infectiousness_Multiplier.description: multiplier to control differential infectiousness across strains

Strain2_Infectiousness_Multiplier.description: multiplier to control differential infectiousness across strains

Strain3_Infectiousness_Multiplier.description: multiplier to control differential infectiousness across strains

Strain4_Infectiousness_Multiplier.description: multiplier to control differential infectiousness across strains

Symptomatic_Probability_Naive.description: Probability to become infected upon acquirine a first infection. Based on Meta-analysis of studies reviewed in Grange et al. 2015 and ten Bosch et al. 2016

Symptomatic_Probability_Reinfected.description: Probability to become infected upon acquirine a secondary infection. Based on Meta-analysis of studies reviewed in Grange et al. 2015 and ten Bosch et al. 2016

Symptomatic_Probability_Postsecondary.description: Probability to become infected upon acquirine a post-secondarily infection. Based on Meta-analysis of studies reviewed in Grange et al. 2015 and ten Bosch et al. 2016

Symptomatic_Reporting_Rate.description: Probability of being reported given symptoms. for dengue a default of 8% as per Stanaway et al. Lancet 2016

Reporting_Period_Distribution.description: Distribution of duration of incubation period. Can be fixed or exponentially distributed with an average duration from Base_Incubation_Period. Possible values are: FIXED_DURATION and EXPONENTIAL_DURATION.

Reporting_Period_Log_Mean.description: mean of log normal duration until reporting

Reporting_Period_Log_Width.description: log width of log normal duration until reporting

Strain1_Background_Exposure.description: background force of infection for strain 1

Strain2_Background_Exposure.description: background force of infection for strain 2

Strain3_Background_Exposure.description: background force of infection for strain 3

Strain4_Background_Exposure.description: background force of infection for strain 4

Listed_Events.description: The list of valid, user-defined events that will be included in the campaign. Any event used in the campaign must either be one of the built-in events or in this list.

HIV_Child_Survival_Rapid_Progressor_Rate.description: The exponential decay rate, in years, describing the distribution of HIV survival for children who are rapid progressors.

HIV_Child_Survival_Slow_Progressor_Shape.description: The Weibull shape parameter describing the distribution of HIV survival for children who are slower progressors.

HIV_Child_Survival_Slow_Progressor_Scale.description: The Weibull scale parameter describing the distribution of HIV survival for children who are slower progressors.

HIV_Child_Survival_Rapid_Progressor_Frac.description: Determines time since infection, in months, over which the Acute_Stage_Infectivity_Multiplier is applied to coital acts occurring in that time period.

HIV_Age_Max_for_Child_Survival_Function.description: Individuals infected at ages younger than HIV_Age_Max_for_Child_Survival_Function use the child survival function. Older individuals use the adult age-dependent survival function. When this parameter is set above zero and below the age of sexual debut, model results are not sensitive to this parameter value because there is no mechanism for children to become infected between infancy and sexual debut.

HIV_Age_Max_for_Adult_Age_Dependent_Surv.description: Extrapolation of this linear decline to high values of age can lead to negative values of lambda, which are not valid. To avoid negative lambda values, a maximum age is set using the parameter HIV_Age_Max_for_Age_Dependent_Survival. All individuals infected at ages greater than HIV_Age_Max_for_Age_Dependent_Survival use the survival distribution corresponding to the age set by HIV_Age_Max_for_Age_Dependent_Survival. HIV incidence in many scenarios will be relatively low in these age groups, so model results are usually not highly sensitive to this parameter value.

HIV_Adult_Survival_Scale_Parameter_Slope.description: At the time of infection, survival time is drawn from a Weibull distribution with a scale parameter that can vary linearly with age as follows: HIV_Adult_Survival_Lambda_Intercept + HIV_Adult_Survival_Lambda_Slope*Age (in years). Because survival with HIV becomes shorter with increasing age, this parameter is normally set to a negative number.

HIV_Adult_Survival_Scale_Parameter_Inter.description: At the time of infection, survival time is drawn from a Weibull distribution with a scale parameter that can vary linearly with age as follows: HIV_Adult_Survival_Lambda_Intercept + HIV_Adult_Survival_Lambda_Slope*Age (in years). This parameter sets the y-intercept of the line.

HIV_Adult_Survival_Shape_Parameter.description: At the time of infection, survival time is drawn from a Weibull distribution with this scale parameter.

Acute_Duration_In_Months.description: Determines time since infection, in months, over which the Acute_Stage_Infectivity_Multiplier is applied to coital acts occurring in that time period.

AIDS_Duration_In_Months.description: Determines the time period prior to an AIDS-related death over which the AIDS_Stage_Infectivity_Multiplier is applied.

Acute_Stage_Infectivity_Multiplier.description: Multiplier acting on Base_Infectivity to determine the per-act transmission probability of a HIV+ individual during the acute stage.

AIDS_Stage_Infectivity_Multiplier.description: Multiplier acting on Base_Infectivity to determine the per-act transmission probability of a HIV+ individual during the AIDS stage.

ART_Viral_Suppression_Multiplier.description: Multiplier acting on Base_Infectivity to determine the per-act transmission probability of a virally suppressed HIV+ individual.

Heterogeneous_Infectiousness_LogNormal_S.description: Scale parameter of a LogNormal distribution that governs an infectiousness multiplier. The multiplier represents heterogeneity in infectivity, and adjusts Base_Infectivity.

ART_CD4_at_Initiation_Saturating_Reducti.description: The duration from ART enrollment to on-ART HIV-cause death increases with CD4 at ART initiation up to a threshold determined by this parameter value.

CD4_Post_Infection_Weibull_Scale.description: Scale parameter of a Weibull distribution that represents the post-acute-infection CD4 cell count.

CD4_Post_Infection_Weibull_Heterogeneity.description: Inverse shape parameter of a Weibull distribution that represents the post-acute-infection CD4 cell count.

CD4_At_Death_LogLogistic_Scale.description: Scale parameter of a Weibull distribution that represents the at-death CD4 cell count.

CD4_At_Death_LogLogistic_Heterogeneity.description: Inverse shape parameter of a Weibull distribution that represents the at-death CD4 cell count.

Days_Between_Symptomatic_And_Death_Weibu.description: Time between onset of AIDS symptoms and death is sampled from a Weibull distribution. This parameter governs the scale of the Weibull.
Time between onset of AIDS symptoms and death is sampled from a Weibull distribution.  This parameter governs the heterogeneity (inverse shape) of the Weibull.

Report_Event_Recorder_Ignore_Events_In_L.description: If this flag is set to true, all events listed in Report_Event_Recorder_Events will be ignored. If it is set to false, all events will be recorded.

Report_Event_Recorder_Events.description: The list of events to include or exclude in the ReportEventRecorder.csv output file. This is available for both STI_SIM and HIV_SIM, but HIV_SIM simulations will have additional columns.

Report_Event_Recorder_Individual_Propert.description: Fraction of individuals in the target demographic that will receive this intervention.

Enable_Aging.description: Set to 1 to account for aging in the population. Set to 0 to assume that the population does not age.

Infection_Updates_Per_Timestep.description: Number of infection updates executed during each timestep. A timestep defaults to one day.

Enable_Immunity.description: Set to 1 if an individual has protective immunity after an infection clears. Set to 0 if recovery from the infection does not affect the individual's future immunity.

Enable_Superinfection.description: Set to 1 if an individual can have multiple infections with the same agent simultaneously. Set to 0 if multiple infections are not possible. See the Max_Individual_Infections parameter.

Max_Individual_Infections.description: Limit on the number of infections that an individual can have simultaneously. Note: Relevant only if the Enable_Superinfection parameter is set to 1 to allow multiple infections.

Minimum_Adult_Age_Years.description: Used for demographic initialization if IndividualAttributes contains PercentageChildren in migration reporting (libhumanmigrationtracking) and in SusceptibilityTB.

Enable_Skipping.description: Enables optimization that can speed-up performance up to 50% in some cases by probablistically exposing individuals rather than exposing every single person. Useful in low-prevalence high population scenarios.

Migration_Pattern.description: The type of roundtrip. For example, a single roundtrip. Possible values are: RANDOM_WALK_DIFFUSION, SINGLE_ROUND_TRIPS and WAYPOINTS_HOME.

Local_Migration_Roundtrip_Probability.description: Likelihood that an individual who walks into a neighboring cell will return to the cell of origin during the next migration. Relevant only when Enable_Local_Migration is selected.

Air_Migration_Roundtrip_Probability.description: Likelihood that an individual who flies to another cell will return to the cell of origin during the next migration. Relevant only when Enable_Air_Migration is selected.

Regional_Migration_Roundtrip_Probability.description: Likelihood that an individual who travels by vehicle to another cell will return to the cell of origin during the next migration. Relevant only when Enable_Regional_Migration is checked.

Sea_Migration_Roundtrip_Probability.description: Likelihood that an individual who travels by ship into a neighboring cell will return to the cell of origin during the next migration. Relevant only when Enable_Sea_Migration is checked.

Local_Migration_Roundtrip_Duration.description: The average time spent at the destination node during a round-trip migration by foot travel.

Air_Migration_Roundtrip_Duration.description: The average time spent at the destination node during a round-trip migration by airplane.

Regional_Migration_Roundtrip_Duration.description: The average time spent at the destination node during a round-trip migration by road network.

Sea_Migration_Roundtrip_Duration.description: The average time spent at the destination node during a round-trip migration by ship.

Family_Migration_Roundtrip_Duration.description: The number of days to complete the trip and return to the original node.

Roundtrip_Waypoints.description: The maximum number of points reached during a trip before steps are retraced on the return trip home.

Maternal_Transmission_ART_Multiplier.description: Maternal transmission multiplier for on-ART mothers.

Sexual_Debut_Age_Male_Weibull_Heterogene.description: Inverse shape of Weibull for male debut age.

Sexual_Debut_Age_Male_Weibull_Scale.description: Scale of Weibull for male debut age.

Sexual_Debut_Age_Female_Weibull_Heteroge.description: Inverse shape of Weibull for female debut age.

Sexual_Debut_Age_Female_Weibull_Scale.description: Scale of Weibull for female debut age.

STI_Coinfection_Acquisition_Multiplier.description: Per-act HIV acquisition probability multiplier for individuals with the STI coinfection flag.

STI_Coinfection_Transmission_Multiplier.description: Per-act HIV transmission probability multiplier for individuals with the STI coinfection flag.

Min_Days_Between_Adding_Relationships.description: Minimum number of days between adding two consecutive relationships as a means to control concurrency.  The constraint does not apply if an individual breaks an existing relationship.

Male_To_Female_Relative_Infectivity_Ages.description: Vector of ages governing the susceptibility of females relative to males, by age.

Male_To_Female_Relative_Infectivity_Mult.description: Vector of multiplicative factors governing the susceptibility of females relative to males, by age.  Multipliers are linearly interpolated between ages.  The left (right)-most value is used before (after) the first (last) age.

Condom_Transmission_Blocking_Probability.description: Per-act multiplier of the transmission probability when a condom is used.

Coital_Dilution_Factor_2_Partners.description: Multiplicative reduction in the coital act rate for all relationship types when an individual has exactly two current partners. Represents coital dilution.

Coital_Dilution_Factor_3_Partners.description: Multiplicative reduction in the coital act rate for all relationship types when an individual has exactly three current partners. Represents coital dilution.

Coital_Dilution_Factor_4_Plus_Partners.description: Multiplicative reduction in the coital act rate for all relationship types when an individual has four or more current partners. Represents coital dilution.

Enable_Disease_Mortality.description: Set to 1 to enable disease mortality. Set to 0 to disable disease mortality.

Mortality_Time_Course.description: Determines whether disease deaths are calculated on every time step or once at the end of the disease duration. Possible values are: DAILY_MORTALITY and MORTALITY_AFTER_INFECTIOUS.

Base_Mortality.description: The base mortality of the infection before accounting for individual immune modification factors. Depending on the setting of Mortality_Time_Course, this is either the daily probability of the disease being fatal (DAILY_MORTALITY) or the probability of death at the end of the infection duration (MORTALITY_AFTER_INFECTIOUS).

Base_Infectivity.description: The Base_Infectivity parameter determines the base infectiousness of individuals before accounting for transmission-blocking effects of acquired immunity and/or campaign interventions. It has a slightly different meaning for each of the disease types. GENERIC_SIM: The average number of individuals per time step who will be exposed to infection by one infectious individual. In the case of super-infection, the infectiousness is summed over all infections. VECTOR_SIM: The probability of infecting a mosquito during a successful blood meal (modulated by the vector parameter Acquire_Modifier). For vector simulations, the sum infectiousness of an individual is not allowed to exceed 100%. MALARIA_SIM: This simple scale factor is not used. Instead, gametocyte abundances and cytokine-mediated infectiousness are modeled explicitly.

Incubation_Period_Distribution.description: Distribution of duration of incubation period. Can be fixed or exponentially distributed with an average duration from Base_Incubation_Period. Possible values are: FIXED_DURATION and EXPONENTIAL_DURATION.

Incubation_Period_Min.description: The minimum length of the incubation period. Used when the Incubation_Period_Distribution is UNIFORM_DURATION.

Incubation_Period_Max.description: The maximum length of the incubation period. Used when Incubation_Period_Distribution is UNIFORM_DURATION.

Incubation_Period_Mean.description: The standard deviation used when Incubation_Period_Distribution is either GAUSSIAN_DURATION or POISSON_DURATION.

Incubation_Period_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation incubation period. Used when the Incubation_Period_Distribution is GAUSSIAN_DURATION.

Base_Incubation_Period.description: Average duration, in days, of the incubation period before infected individuals becomes infectious.

Infectious_Period_Distribution.description: Distribution of duration of infectious period. Can be fixed or exponentially distributed with an average duration from Base_Infectious_Period. Possible values are: FIXED_DURATION, EXPONENTIAL_DURATION.

depends-on.Simulation_Type: GENERIC_SIM, POLIO_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, ENVIRONMENTAL_SIM, PY_SIM, STI_SIM, TBHIV_SIM, TYPHOID_SIM

Base_Infectious_Period.description: Average duration, in days, of the infectious period before the infection is cleared.

Infectious_Period_Min.description: The minimum length of the infectious period. Used when the Infectious_Period_Distribution is UNIFORM_DURATION.

Infectious_Period_Max.description: The maximum length of the infectious period. Used when Infectious_Period_Distribution is UNIFORM_DURATION.

Infectious_Period_Mean.description: The mean of the infectious period. Used when Infectious_Period_Distribution is either GAUSSIAN_DURATION or POISSON_DURATION.

Infectious_Period_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation of the infectious period. Used when the Infectious_Period_Distribution is GAUSSIAN_DURATION.

Malaria_Model.description: The type of malaria model used in a simulation. Possible values are:  MALARIA_FIXED_DURATION, MALARIA_EXPONENTIAL_DURATION, MALARIA_REDUCEDSTATE_MODEL and  MALARIA_MECHANISTIC_MODEL.  Important: All malaria simulations should use MALARIA_MECHANISTIC_MODEL. The others are placeholder values.

Mean_Sporozoites_Per_Bite.description: Mean number of sporozoites per infectious mosquito bite.

Base_Sporozoite_Survival_Fraction.description: Fraction of sporozoites that survive to infect a hepatocyte in the absence of anti-CSP protection.

Antibody_CSP_Killing_Threshold.description: Threshold value on CSP antibody concentration for sporozoite killing.

Antibody_CSP_Killing_Inverse_Width.description: Inverse width of sigmoidal sporozoite killing function of CSP antibody concentration.

Malaria_Strain_Model.description: The generator that is used to construct the antigenic repertoire of a malaria infection. Possible values are: FALCIPARUM_NONRANDOM_STRAIN, FALCIPARUM_RANDOM50_STRAIN, FALCIPARUM_RANDOM_STRAIN and FALCIPARUM_STRAIN_GENERATOR.

Parasite_Switch_Type.description: Parasite switch type for erythrocyte surface antigens. Possible values are: CONSTANT_SWITCH_RATE_2VARS, RATE_PER_PARASITE_7VARS - this is the one that is best parameterized - and finally,  RATE_PER_PARASITE_5VARS_DECAYING.

Antibody_IRBC_Kill_Rate.description: Factor multiplied by antibody level to produce the rate of clearance of the infected red blood cell (IRBC) population.

Nonspecific_Antigenicity_Factor.description: Nonspecific antigenicity factor that adjusts antibody IRBC killrate to account for IRBCs caused by antibody responses to antigenically weak surface proteins.

MSP1_Merozoite_Kill_Fraction.description: Fraction of merozoites inhibited from invading new erythrocytes when MSP1-specific antibody level is 1.

Gametocyte_Stage_Survival_Rate.description: Rate of gametocyte survival from one development stage to the next in the absence of drugs or inflammatory immune response.

Base_Gametocyte_Fraction_Male.description: Fraction of gametocytes that are male.

Antigen_Switch_Rate.description: Antigenic switching rate per infected red blood cell per asexual cycle. See Parasite_Switch_Type for different switching patterns.

Merozoites_Per_Hepatocyte.description: Number of IRBCs caused by a single infected hepatocyte at the start of infection.

Merozoites_Per_Schizont.description: Number of merozoites released by a single infected schizont after each asexual cycle. The number of resulting IRBC's depends on the RBC availability and merozoite-specific immunity.

RBC_Destruction_Multiplier.description: Number of total RBCs destroyed per infected rupturing schizont.

Number_Of_Asexual_Cycles_Without_Gametoc.description: Number of asexual reproduction cycles that do not produce gametocytes. All later cycles will produce gametocytes according to Base_Gametocyte_Production_Rate.

Anemia_Mortality_Threshold.description: The threshold value on hemoglobin count in grams per deciliter (g/dL) at which 50% of individuals die per day.

Parasite_Mortality_Threshold.description: The parasite-density mortality threshold for a simulation.

Fever_Mortality_Threshold.description: The fever mortality threshold for a simulation in units of degrees Celsius above normal body temperature. Sets the midpoint in the sigmoidal response for mortality rate associated with fever.

Enable_Sexual_Combination.description: Set to 1 to enable sexual combination of male and female gametocytes. Set to 0 for transmission of each strain only. Note: This parameter is currently not in use.

Base_Gametocyte_Mosquito_Survival_Rate.description: Average fraction of gametocytes in blood meal that are successful in infecting mosquito in the absence of other modulating effects, such as fever.

Cytokine_Gametocyte_Inactivation.description: The strength of inflammatory response inactivation of gametocytes.

Anemia_Mortality_Inverse_Width.description: The inverse width relative to threshold value of severe disease turn-on around threshold for anemia.

Parasite_Mortality_Inverse_Width.description: The inverse width relative to threshold value of mortality turn-on around threshold for parasite density.

Fever_Mortality_Inverse_Width.description: The inverse width relative to threshold value of mortality turn-on around threshold for fever.

Anemia_Severe_Threshold.description: The severe disease threshold level for anemia. Threshold units are in grams per deciliter (g/dL).

Parasite_Severe_Threshold.description: The severe disease threshold level for parasite density.

Fever_Severe_Threshold.description: The severe disease threshold level for fever.

Anemia_Severe_Inverse_Width.description: The inverse width relative to threshold value of severe disease turn-on around threshold for anemia.

Parasite_Severe_Inverse_Width.description: The inverse width relative to threshold value of severe disease turn-on around threshold for parasite density.

Fever_Severe_Inverse_Width.description: The inverse width relative to threshold value of severe disease turn-on around threshold for fever.

Clinical_Fever_Threshold_Low.description: The fever threshold (in degrees Celsius above normal) to end a clinical incident.

Clinical_Fever_Threshold_High.description: The fever threshold (in degrees Celsius above normal) to start a clinical incident.

Min_Days_Between_Clinical_Incidents.description: The number of days with fever below the low threshold before a new incident can start when the high fever threshold is again exceeded.

Antibody_Memory_Level.description: Limiting level of antibody capacity that remains after a prolonged absence of a specific antigen. The antibody capacity decays to this level gradually after infection is cleared. The decay rate in antibody capacity is set so that hyperimmunity is lost within 4 months, and capacity continues to decay to this level. The antibody memory level is relevant for year-scale dynamics, but not for long dynamics (10-20 years).

Max_MSP1_Antibody_Growthrate.description: Maximum increase in MSP1 antibody capacity during each asexual cycle. The higher this value, the sooner early clearances are observed and the earlier the parasite density envelope decreases.

Antibody_Stimulation_C50.description: Concentration of an antigen, measured in IRBC/ul at which growth in antibody capacity against the antigen increases at half the maximum rate specified by Antibody_Capacity_Growth_Rate.

Antibody_Capacity_Growth_Rate.description: Maximum daily rate of specific antibody capacity increase. Antibody production begins at capacity of 0.3. Hyperimmunity results at 0.4. The actual growth rate will tend to be lower and is a function of antigen concentrations.

Min_Adapted_Response.description: Minimum level of antibody stimulation to novel antigen. The value sets the low-range asymptote for antibody capacity growth, which is calculated from Antibody_Capacity_Growth_Rate and antigen density, in the presence of any nonzero antigen level.

Nonspecific_Antibody_Growth_Rate_Factor.description: Factor that adjusts Antibody_Capacity_Growth_Rate for less immunogenic surface proteins called the minor epitopes.

Antibody_CSP_Decay_Days.description: Exponential decay time for CSP antibody concentration (in days).

Erythropoiesis_Anemia_Effect.description: Exponential rate of increased red-blood-cell production from reduced red-blood-cell availability.

Enable_Maternal_Antibodies_Transmission.description: Controls whether or not mothers pass antibodies to their infants.

Maternal_Antibodies_Type.description: Type of maternal antibody protection.  Possible values are: OFF, SIMPLE_WANING, CONSTANT_INITIAL_IMMUNITY (independent of acquired immunity in possible mothers).

Maternal_Antibody_Protection.description: Strength of protection from maternal antibodies as a multiple of full antibody killing effect.

Maternal_Antibody_Decay_Rate.description: Decay rate per day in protection from maternal antibodies.

Innate_Immune_Variation_Type.description: Type of individual innate immune variation.  Possible values are: NONE (homogeneous), PYROGENIC_THRESHOLD (parasite threshold resulting in cytokine production), PYROGENIC_THRESHOLD_VS_AGE (age-dependent threshold), CYTOKINE_KILLING (effectiveness of cytokines in killing infected red-blood cells).

Pyrogenic_Threshold.description: Level of bloodstream infection, measured in IRBC per microliter, at which stimulation of the innate inflammatory immune response is half its maximum value.

Fever_IRBC_Kill_Rate.description: Factor multiplied by fever level to produce a decay rate of infected red blood cell population due to inflammatory innate immune response.

Memory_Usage_Warning_Threshold_Working_S.description: TBD-If the Working Set memory size exceeds this value, the memory usage statistics will be written to the log regardless of log level.

Memory_Usage_Halting_Threshold_Working_S.description: TBD-If the Working Set memory size exceeds this value, the system will throw an exception and halt.

x_Local_Migration.description: Multiplier for rate of migration by foot travel.

Enable_Migration_Heterogeneity.description: Set to 1 to use migration rate distribution in the demographics file. Set to 0 to assume by default that the same migration rate applies for all individuals.

Enable_Local_Migration.description: Set to 1 to enable local migration, the diffusion of people in and out of nearby nodes by foot travel. Set to 0 to disable local migration.

Enable_Air_Migration.description: Set to 1 to account for migration by airplane in and out of cities with airports. Set to 0 to assume by default that no migration occurs by air travel.

Enable_Regional_Migration.description: Set to 1 to account for migration by road vehicle in and out of nodal cities in the road network. Set to 0 to assume by default that no migration occurs by road travel.

Enable_Sea_Migration.description: Set to 1 to account for migration on ships in and out of coastal cities with seaports. Set to 0 to assume by default that no migration occurs by sea travel.

Enable_Family_Migration.description: Set to 1 to enable migration of all members of a household. All residents must be home before they can leave on the trip.

Local_Migration_Filename.description: Path of input file defining patterns of migration to adjacent nodes by foot travel.

Air_Migration_Filename.description: Path of input file defining patterns of migration by airplane.

Regional_Migration_Filename.description: Path of input file defining patterns of migration by vehicle via road or rail network. If the node is not on a road or rail network, regional migration focuses on the closest hub city in the network.

Sea_Migration_Filename.description: Path of input file defining patterns of migration by ship.

Family_Migration_Filename.description: The name of the binary file to use to configure family migration.

x_Local_Migration.description: Multiplier for rate of migration by foot travel.

x_Air_Migration.description: Multiplier for rate of migration by air.

x_Regional_Migration.description: Multiplier for rate of migration by road vehicle.

x_Sea_Migration.description: Multiplier for rate of migration by sea.

x_Family_Migration.description: Multiplier for rate of migration by families.

Enable_Migration_Heterogeneity.description: Set to 1 to use migration rate distribution in the demographics file. Set to 0 to assume by default that the same migration rate applies for all individuals.

Enable_Local_Migration.description: Set to 1 to enable local migration, the diffusion of people in and out of nearby nodes by foot travel. Set to 0 to disable local migration.

Enable_Regional_Migration.description: Set to 1 to account for migration by road vehicle in and out of nodal cities in the road network. Set to 0 to assume by default that no migration occurs by road travel.

Enable_Sea_Migration.description: Set to 1 to account for migration on ships in and out of coastal cities with seaports. Set to 0 to assume by default that no migration occurs by sea travel.

Local_Migration_Filename.description: Path of input file defining patterns of migration to adjacent nodes by foot travel.

Air_Migration_Filename.description: Path of input file defining patterns of migration by airplane.

Regional_Migration_Filename.description: Path of input file defining patterns of migration by vehicle via road or rail network. If the node is not on a road or rail network, regional migration focuses on the closest hub city in the network.

Sea_Migration_Filename.description: Path of input file defining patterns of migration by ship.

Family_Migration_Filename.description: The name of the binary file to use to configure family migration.

x_Local_Migration.description: Multiplier for rate of migration by foot travel.

x_Air_Migration.description: Multiplier for rate of migration by air.

x_Regional_Migration.description: Multiplier for rate of migration by road vehicle.

x_Sea_Migration.description: Multiplier for rate of migration by sea.

x_Family_Migration.description: Multiplier for rate of migration by families.

Enable_Vector_Migration.description: Set to 1 to enable vector migration. Set to 0 to disable vector migration. Note: Only supported for individual-vector model with Vector_Sampling_Type value of TRACK_ALL_VECTORS or SAMPLE_IND_VECTORS.

Vector_Migration_Modifier_Equation.description: Functional form of vector migration modifiers.

Enable_Vector_Migration_Local.description: Set to 1 to consider local vector migration by vectors to adjacent nodes. Set to 0 to not consider local vector migration.

Enable_Vector_Migration_Regional.description: Set to 1 to consider regional vector migration by vectors to non-adjacent nodes. Set to 0 to not consider regional vector migration.

Vector_Migration_Filename_Local.description: Path of input file defining patterns of vector migration to adjacent nodes.

Vector_Migration_Filename_Regional.description: Path of input file defining patterns of vector migration to non-adjacent nodes.

x_Vector_Migration_Local.description: Multiplier for rate of vector migration to adjacent nodes.

x_Vector_Migration_Regional.description: Multiplier for rate of vector migration to non-adjacent nodes.

Vector_Migration_Habitat_Modifier.description: Preference of a vector to migrate toward a node with more habitat. Only relevant when VECTOR_SAMPLING_TYPE is TRACK_ALL_VECTORS.

Vector_Migration_Food_Modifier.description: Preference of a vector to migrate toward a node currently occupied by humans, independent of the number of humans in the node. Only relevant when VECTOR_SAMPLING_TYPE is TRACK_ALL_VECTORS.

Vector_Migration_Stay_Put_Modifier.description: Preference of a vector to remain in its current node rather than migrate to another node. Only relevant when VECTOR_SAMPLING_TYPE is TRACK_ALL_VECTORS.

x_Local_Migration.description: Multiplier for rate of migration by foot travel.

Enable_Vector_Migration.description: Set to 1 to enable vector migration. Set to 0 to disable vector migration. Note: Only supported for individual-vector model with Vector_Sampling_Type value of TRACK_ALL_VECTORS or SAMPLE_IND_VECTORS.

x_Vector_Migration_Local.description: Multiplier for rate of migration by foot travel.

Enable_Vital_Dynamics.description: Set to 1 as a master switch to enable vital dynamics (births and deaths). Set to 0 to disable vital dynamics. Even when set to 1, the individual toggles for births and deaths can still disable these.

Enable_Natural_Mortality.description: Controls whether or not individuals are removed from the simulation due to natural (non-disease) deaths. Enable_Vital_Dynamics must be set to true (1).

Death_Rate_Dependence.description: This parameter determines how the death rate specified in the demographics file is used. Possible values are: NONDISEASE_MORTALITY_OFF, NONDISEASE_MORTALITY_BY_AGE_AND_GENDER and NONDISEASE_MORTALITY_BY_YEAR_AND_AGE_FOR_EACH_GENDER.

Enable_Susceptibility_Scaling.description: Boolean value; setting true enables susceptibility scaling by time as defined by Susceptibility_Scaling_Type.

Susceptibility_Scaling_Type.description: Enumeration of susceptibility scaling types. Possible values are: CONSTANT_SUSCEPTIBILITY, LOG_LINEAR_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.

Susceptibility_Scaling_Rate.description: The scaling rate for the variation in time of the log-linear susceptibility scaling.

Base_Individual_Sample_Rate.description: Base rate of sampling for individuals. This rate equals the fraction of individuals in each node being sampled.

Age_Initialization_Distribution_Type.description: Method for initializing the age distribution in the simulated population. Possible values are: DISTRIBUTION_OFF - All individuals default to age 20-years-old. DISTRIBUTION_SIMPLE - Individual ages are drawn from a distribution whose functional form and parameters are specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layers: 'AgeDistributionFlag', 'AgeDistribution1', and 'AgeDistribution2'. DISTRIBUTION_COMPLEX - Individual ages are drawn from a piecewise linear distribution specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layer 'AgeDistribution'.

Infectivity_Scale_Type.description: Alter infectivity by time or season.  Possible values are: CONSTANT_INFECTIVITY - No infectivity correction is applied.  FUNCTION_OF_TIME_AND_LATITUDE - Infectivity is corrected for approximate seasonal forcing.  The use of a seasonal infectivity correction is a proxy for the effects of varying climate.  From October through March, infectivity increases in the Northern Hemisphere and decreases in the Southern Hemisphere.  From April through September, the trend reverses.  Regions closer to the equator have reduced forcing compared to temperate regions.  This is not a substitute for the weather-driven vector dynamics of vector-borne and malaria simulations.  FUNCTION_OF_CLIMATE - Allows infectivity to be modulated by weather directly, for example, relative humidity in airborne simulations or rainfall in environmental simulations.  There is no default climate dependence enabled for generic simulations.  EXPONENTIAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME - To facilitate certain burn-in scenarios, infectivity ramps up from zero at the beginning of the simulation according to the functional form, 1-exp(-rate*time), where the rate is specified by the parameter Infectivity_Scaling_Rate.

Infectivity_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Only used or needed when Infectivity_Scale_Type is set to SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.  Sets the amplitude of sinusoidal variations in Base_Infectivity.

Infectivity_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Phase.description: Only used or needed when Infectivity_Scale_Type is set to SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.  Sets the phase of sinusoidal variations in Base_Infectivity.

Infectivity_Exponential_Baseline.description: Multiplier on base_infectivity at simtime = 0 for Infectivity_Scale_Type = EXPONENTIAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.

Infectivity_Exponential_Delay.description: Sets delay before infectivity begins to ramp up for Infectivity_Scale_Type = EXPONENTIAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME

Infectivity_Exponential_Rate.description: Sets the rate ofexponential approach to full infectivity after the delay for Infectivity_Scale_Type = EXPONENTIAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME

Infectivity_Boxcar_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Fractional increase in R0 during high infectivity season, when Infectivity_Scale_Type is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Infectivity_Boxcar_Forcing_Start_Time.description: Beginning of high infectivity season, when Infectivity_Scale_Type is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Infectivity_Boxcar_Forcing_End_Time.description: End of high infectivity season, when Infectivity_Scale_Type is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Animal_Reservoir_Type.description: Configures whether there is an animal reservoir and how the risk of zoonosis in configured. Use of the animal reservoir sets a low constant baseline of infectivity beyond what is present in the human population. It allows a more random introduction of cases in continuous time, which is more applicable for various situations such as zoonosis. Possible values are: NO_ZOONOSIS, CONSTANT_ZOONOSIS where the daily rate of zoonotic infection is configured by the parameter Zoonosis_Rate, and ZOONOSIS_FROM_DEMOGRAPHICS where the zoonosis rate is additionally scaled by the node-specific Zoonosis value in the NodeAttributes section of a demographics overlay file.  See Zoonosis_Rate.

Zoonosis_Rate.description: The daily rate of zoonotic infection per individual when the Animal_Reservoir_Type parameter is set to either CONSTANT_ZOONOSIS or ZOONOSIS_FROM_DEMOGRAPHICS.

x_Other_Mortality.description: Multiplier for scaling mortality from causes other than disease being simulated.

Enable_Initial_Prevalence.description: Controls whether or not parameters in the demographics file are used to define a distribution for the number of infected people per node at the beginning of the simulation. Set the distribution under IndividualAttributes using PrevalenceDistributionFlag, PrevalenceDistribution1, and PrevalenceDistribution2.

Enable_Birth.description: Set to 1 to enable individuals to be added to the simulation by birth.

Enable_Demographics_Risk.description: Controls whether or not the simulation includes the impact of disease risk in demographics.

Enable_Demographics_Gender.description: Enable_Demographics_Gender=0 assigns gender based on a 50/50 draw, while Enable_Demographics_Gender=1 draws from a male/female ratio that is randomly smeared by a Gaussian of width 1%.

Enable_Immunity_Distribution.description: Controls whether or not individuals in the population have immunity at the beginning of the simulation. If set to 0, individuals are not initialized with immunity but may acquire immunity. If set to 1, you must indicate the type of distribution to use for immunity in the configuration parameter Immunity_Initialization_Distribution_Type and the distribution values in the demographics file.

Enable_Maternal_Infection_Transmission.description: Set to 1 to account for infection of infants at birth by infected mothers. Set to 0 to assume that infection is not transmitted by mothers to infants at birth.

Maternal_Infection_Transmission_Probabil.description: Probability of transmission of infection from mother to infant at birth. Relevant only if Enable_Maternal_Infection_Transmission is set to 1. Note: This parameter should be set to 0 and ignored for malaria and vector simulations.

Enable_Demographics_Birth.description: Assumes that newborn characteristics such as sickle-cell status are heterogeneous. Set to 0 to assume by default that all newborns have identical characteristics.

Birth_Rate_Dependence.description: This parameter determines how the birth rate specified in the demographics file is used. Possible values are: FIXED_BIRTH_RATE- The absolute rate at which new individuals are born. POPULATION_DEP_RATE - Scales the node population to determine the birth rate. DEMOGRAPHIC_DEP_RATE - Scales the female population within fertility age ranges to determine the birth rate. INDIVIDUAL_PREGNANCIES - Results in a similar birth rate as DEMOGRAPHIC_DEP_RATE, but pregnancies are assigned on an individual basis and result in a 40-week pregnancy for a specific individual with a birth at the end, INDIVIDUAL_PREGNANCIES_BY_URBAN_AND_AGE, and INDIVIDUAL_PREGNANCIES_BY_AGE_AND_YEAR.

Individual_Sampling_Type.description: Type of individual human sampling. Possible values are: TRACK_ALL, FIXED_SAMPLING, ADAPTED_SAMPLING_BY_POPULATION_SIZE, ADAPTED_SAMPLING_BY_AGE_GROUP, and ADAPTED_SAMPLING_BY_AGE_GROUP_AND_POP_SIZE.

Relative_Sample_Rate_Immune.description: Relative sampling rate for people who have acquired immunity - through recovery or vaccination.

Immune_Threshold_For_Downsampling.description: Threshold on acquisition immunity at which to apply immunity dependent downsampling.  Only matters when Individual_Sampling_Type is set to ADAPTED_SAMPLING_BY_IMMUNE_STATE.

Sample_Rate_Birth.description: Relative of relative sampling for births for age-adapted sampling.

Sample_Rate_0_18mo.description: Relative sampling rate for infants for the 0-18-month age group for age-adapted sampling.

Sample_Rate_18mo_4yr.description: Relative sampling rate for children in the age group 18 months to 4 years for age-adapted sampling.

Sample_Rate_5_9.description: Relative sampling rate for children in the age group 5-9 years for age-adapted sampling.

Sample_Rate_10_14.description: Relative sampling rate for children in the age group 10-14 years for age-adapted sampling.

Sample_Rate_15_19.description: Relative sampling rate for adolescents in the age group 15-19 years for age-adapted sampling.

Sample_Rate_20_Plus.description: Relative sampling rate for young adults in the age group 20 years or greater for age-adapted sampling.

Max_Node_Population_Samples.description: Number of individuals when the sampling rate starts dropping to the rate of adapted sampling by population size.

Population_Scale_Type.description: Either use the initial population specified in the demographics input file or a fixed scaling of this value based on the population scaling factor parameter. Possible values are: USE_INPUT_FILE and FIXED_SCALING.

Base_Population_Scale_Factor.description: If Population_Scale_Type is set to FIXED_SCALING, the initial simulation population is uniformly scaled over the entire area to adjust for historical or future population density.

Population_Density_Infectivity_Correctio.description: Correction to alter infectivity by population density set in the Population_Density_C50 parameter. Measured in people per sq. km. Possible values are:  CONSTANT_INFECTIVITY and SATURATING_FUNCTION_OF_DENSITY.   Note: Sparsely populated areas have a lower infectivity, while densely populated areas have a higher infectivity which rises to saturate at the Base_Infectivity value.

Population_Density_C50.description: If the Population_Density_Infectivity_Correction parameter is set to SATURATING_FUNCTION_OF_DENSITY, this parameter specifies the population density at which R0 for a 2.5-arc minute square reaches half of its initial value.

x_Birth.description: Multiplier of birth rate from input demographics file.

Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence.description: Allows for time dependence in the birth rate.  Available values are NONE, SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME, ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Birth_Rate_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Only used or needed when Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence is equal to SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.  Sets the amplitude of sinusoidal variations in birth rate.

Birth_Rate_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Phase.description: Only used or needed when Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence is equal to SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.  Sets the phase of sinusoidal variations in birth rate.

Birth_Rate_Boxcar_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Fractional increase in birth rate during high birth season, when Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Birth_Rate_Boxcar_Forcing_Start_Time.description: Beginning of high birth rate season, when Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Birth_Rate_Boxcar_Forcing_End_Time.description: End of high birth rate season, when Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Demographics_Filenames.description: Array of demographics files containing information on the identity and demographics of the region to simulate.

PFA_Burnin_Duration_In_Days.description: Number of days to continue tuning the pair formation rates.  After this duration, the rates will remain at the last rate value calculated.

Enable_Vital_Dynamics.description: Set to 1 as a master switch to enable vital dynamics (births and deaths). Set to 0 to disable vital dynamics. Even when set to 1, the individual toggles for births and deaths can still disable these.

Enable_Natural_Mortality.description: Controls whether or not individuals are removed from the simulation due to natural (non-disease) deaths. Enable_Vital_Dynamics must be set to true (1).

Death_Rate_Dependence.description: This parameter determines how the death rate specified in the demographics file is used. Possible values are: NONDISEASE_MORTALITY_OFF, NONDISEASE_MORTALITY_BY_AGE_AND_GENDER and NONDISEASE_MORTALITY_BY_YEAR_AND_AGE_FOR_EACH_GENDER.

Enable_Susceptibility_Scaling.description: Boolean value; setting true enables susceptibility scaling by time as defined by Susceptibility_Scaling_Type.

Susceptibility_Scaling_Type.description: Enumeration of susceptibility scaling types. Possible values are: CONSTANT_SUSCEPTIBILITY, LOG_LINEAR_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.

Susceptibility_Scaling_Rate.description: The scaling rate for the variation in time of the log-linear susceptibility scaling.

Base_Individual_Sample_Rate.description: Base rate of sampling for individuals. This rate equals the fraction of individuals in each node being sampled.

Age_Initialization_Distribution_Type.description: Method for initializing the age distribution in the simulated population. Possible values are: DISTRIBUTION_OFF - All individuals default to age 20-years-old. DISTRIBUTION_SIMPLE - Individual ages are drawn from a distribution whose functional form and parameters are specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layers: 'AgeDistributionFlag', 'AgeDistribution1', and 'AgeDistribution2'. DISTRIBUTION_COMPLEX - Individual ages are drawn from a piecewise linear distribution specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layer 'AgeDistribution'.

Infectivity_Scale_Type.description: Alter infectivity by time or season.  Possible values are: CONSTANT_INFECTIVITY - No infectivity correction is applied.  FUNCTION_OF_TIME_AND_LATITUDE - Infectivity is corrected for approximate seasonal forcing.  The use of a seasonal infectivity correction is a proxy for the effects of varying climate.  From October through March, infectivity increases in the Northern Hemisphere and decreases in the Southern Hemisphere.  From April through September, the trend reverses.  Regions closer to the equator have reduced forcing compared to temperate regions.  This is not a substitute for the weather-driven vector dynamics of vector-borne and malaria simulations.  FUNCTION_OF_CLIMATE - Allows infectivity to be modulated by weather directly, for example, relative humidity in airborne simulations or rainfall in environmental simulations.  There is no default climate dependence enabled for generic simulations.  EXPONENTIAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME - To facilitate certain burn-in scenarios, infectivity ramps up from zero at the beginning of the simulation according to the functional form, 1-exp(-rate*time), where the rate is specified by the parameter Infectivity_Scaling_Rate.

Infectivity_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Only used or needed when Infectivity_Scale_Type is set to SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.  Sets the amplitude of sinusoidal variations in Base_Infectivity.

Infectivity_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Phase.description: Only used or needed when Infectivity_Scale_Type is set to SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.  Sets the phase of sinusoidal variations in Base_Infectivity.

Infectivity_Exponential_Baseline.description: Multiplier on base_infectivity at simtime = 0 for Infectivity_Scale_Type = EXPONENTIAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.

Infectivity_Exponential_Delay.description: Sets delay before infectivity begins to ramp up for Infectivity_Scale_Type = EXPONENTIAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME

Infectivity_Exponential_Rate.description: Sets the rate ofexponential approach to full infectivity after the delay for Infectivity_Scale_Type = EXPONENTIAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME

Infectivity_Boxcar_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Fractional increase in R0 during high infectivity season, when Infectivity_Scale_Type is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Infectivity_Boxcar_Forcing_Start_Time.description: Beginning of high infectivity season, when Infectivity_Scale_Type is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Infectivity_Boxcar_Forcing_End_Time.description: End of high infectivity season, when Infectivity_Scale_Type is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Animal_Reservoir_Type.description: Configures whether there is an animal reservoir and how the risk of zoonosis in configured. Use of the animal reservoir sets a low constant baseline of infectivity beyond what is present in the human population. It allows a more random introduction of cases in continuous time, which is more applicable for various situations such as zoonosis. Possible values are: NO_ZOONOSIS, CONSTANT_ZOONOSIS where the daily rate of zoonotic infection is configured by the parameter Zoonosis_Rate, and ZOONOSIS_FROM_DEMOGRAPHICS where the zoonosis rate is additionally scaled by the node-specific Zoonosis value in the NodeAttributes section of a demographics overlay file.  See Zoonosis_Rate.

Zoonosis_Rate.description: The daily rate of zoonotic infection per individual when the Animal_Reservoir_Type parameter is set to either CONSTANT_ZOONOSIS or ZOONOSIS_FROM_DEMOGRAPHICS.

x_Other_Mortality.description: Multiplier for scaling mortality from causes other than disease being simulated.

Enable_Initial_Prevalence.description: Controls whether or not parameters in the demographics file are used to define a distribution for the number of infected people per node at the beginning of the simulation. Set the distribution under IndividualAttributes using PrevalenceDistributionFlag, PrevalenceDistribution1, and PrevalenceDistribution2.

Enable_Birth.description: Set to 1 to enable individuals to be added to the simulation by birth.

Enable_Demographics_Risk.description: Controls whether or not the simulation includes the impact of disease risk in demographics.

Enable_Demographics_Gender.description: Enable_Demographics_Gender=0 assigns gender based on a 50/50 draw, while Enable_Demographics_Gender=1 draws from a male/female ratio that is randomly smeared by a Gaussian of width 1%.

Enable_Immunity_Distribution.description: Controls whether or not individuals in the population have immunity at the beginning of the simulation. If set to 0, individuals are not initialized with immunity but may acquire immunity. If set to 1, you must indicate the type of distribution to use for immunity in the configuration parameter Immunity_Initialization_Distribution_Type and the distribution values in the demographics file.

Enable_Maternal_Infection_Transmission.description: Set to 1 to account for infection of infants at birth by infected mothers. Set to 0 to assume that infection is not transmitted by mothers to infants at birth.

Maternal_Infection_Transmission_Probabil.description: Probability of transmission of infection from mother to infant at birth. Relevant only if Enable_Maternal_Infection_Transmission is set to 1. Note: This parameter should be set to 0 and ignored for malaria and vector simulations.

Enable_Demographics_Birth.description: Assumes that newborn characteristics such as sickle-cell status are heterogeneous. Set to 0 to assume by default that all newborns have identical characteristics.

Birth_Rate_Dependence.description: This parameter determines how the birth rate specified in the demographics file is used. Possible values are: FIXED_BIRTH_RATE- The absolute rate at which new individuals are born. POPULATION_DEP_RATE - Scales the node population to determine the birth rate. DEMOGRAPHIC_DEP_RATE - Scales the female population within fertility age ranges to determine the birth rate. INDIVIDUAL_PREGNANCIES - Results in a similar birth rate as DEMOGRAPHIC_DEP_RATE, but pregnancies are assigned on an individual basis and result in a 40-week pregnancy for a specific individual with a birth at the end, INDIVIDUAL_PREGNANCIES_BY_URBAN_AND_AGE, and INDIVIDUAL_PREGNANCIES_BY_AGE_AND_YEAR.

Individual_Sampling_Type.description: Type of individual human sampling. Possible values are: TRACK_ALL, FIXED_SAMPLING, ADAPTED_SAMPLING_BY_POPULATION_SIZE, ADAPTED_SAMPLING_BY_AGE_GROUP, and ADAPTED_SAMPLING_BY_AGE_GROUP_AND_POP_SIZE.

Relative_Sample_Rate_Immune.description: Relative sampling rate for people who have acquired immunity - through recovery or vaccination.

Immune_Threshold_For_Downsampling.description: Threshold on acquisition immunity at which to apply immunity dependent downsampling.  Only matters when Individual_Sampling_Type is set to ADAPTED_SAMPLING_BY_IMMUNE_STATE.

Sample_Rate_Birth.description: Relative of relative sampling for births for age-adapted sampling.

Sample_Rate_0_18mo.description: Relative sampling rate for infants for the 0-18-month age group for age-adapted sampling.

Sample_Rate_18mo_4yr.description: Relative sampling rate for children in the age group 18 months to 4 years for age-adapted sampling.

Sample_Rate_5_9.description: Relative sampling rate for children in the age group 5-9 years for age-adapted sampling.

Sample_Rate_10_14.description: Relative sampling rate for children in the age group 10-14 years for age-adapted sampling.

Sample_Rate_15_19.description: Relative sampling rate for adolescents in the age group 15-19 years for age-adapted sampling.

Sample_Rate_20_Plus.description: Relative sampling rate for young adults in the age group 20 years or greater for age-adapted sampling.

Max_Node_Population_Samples.description: Number of individuals when the sampling rate starts dropping to the rate of adapted sampling by population size.

Population_Scale_Type.description: Either use the initial population specified in the demographics input file or a fixed scaling of this value based on the population scaling factor parameter. Possible values are: USE_INPUT_FILE and FIXED_SCALING.

Base_Population_Scale_Factor.description: If Population_Scale_Type is set to FIXED_SCALING, the initial simulation population is uniformly scaled over the entire area to adjust for historical or future population density.

Population_Density_Infectivity_Correctio.description: Correction to alter infectivity by population density set in the Population_Density_C50 parameter. Measured in people per sq. km. Possible values are:  CONSTANT_INFECTIVITY and SATURATING_FUNCTION_OF_DENSITY.   Note: Sparsely populated areas have a lower infectivity, while densely populated areas have a higher infectivity which rises to saturate at the Base_Infectivity value.

Population_Density_C50.description: If the Population_Density_Infectivity_Correction parameter is set to SATURATING_FUNCTION_OF_DENSITY, this parameter specifies the population density at which R0 for a 2.5-arc minute square reaches half of its initial value.

x_Birth.description: Multiplier of birth rate from input demographics file.

Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence.description: Allows for time dependence in the birth rate.  Available values are NONE, SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME, ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Birth_Rate_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Only used or needed when Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence is equal to SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.  Sets the amplitude of sinusoidal variations in birth rate.

Birth_Rate_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Phase.description: Only used or needed when Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence is equal to SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.  Sets the phase of sinusoidal variations in birth rate.

Birth_Rate_Boxcar_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Fractional increase in birth rate during high birth season, when Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Birth_Rate_Boxcar_Forcing_Start_Time.description: Beginning of high birth rate season, when Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Birth_Rate_Boxcar_Forcing_End_Time.description: End of high birth rate season, when Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Enable_Vector_Mortality.description: Set to 1 to allow vectors to die. Only relevant when VECTOR_SAMPLING_TYPE is TRACK_ALL_VECTORS.

Mosquito_Weight.description: Value indicating how many mosquitoes are represented by a sample mosquito.  This parameter is only used for Vector_Sampling_Type value SAMPLE_IND_VECTORS.

Enable_Vital_Dynamics.description: Set to 1 as a master switch to enable vital dynamics (births and deaths). Set to 0 to disable vital dynamics. Even when set to 1, the individual toggles for births and deaths can still disable these.

Enable_Natural_Mortality.description: Controls whether or not individuals are removed from the simulation due to natural (non-disease) deaths. Enable_Vital_Dynamics must be set to true (1).

Death_Rate_Dependence.description: This parameter determines how the death rate specified in the demographics file is used. Possible values are: NONDISEASE_MORTALITY_OFF, NONDISEASE_MORTALITY_BY_AGE_AND_GENDER and NONDISEASE_MORTALITY_BY_YEAR_AND_AGE_FOR_EACH_GENDER.

Enable_Susceptibility_Scaling.description: Boolean value; setting true enables susceptibility scaling by time as defined by Susceptibility_Scaling_Type.

Susceptibility_Scaling_Type.description: Enumeration of susceptibility scaling types. Possible values are: CONSTANT_SUSCEPTIBILITY, LOG_LINEAR_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.

Susceptibility_Scaling_Rate.description: The scaling rate for the variation in time of the log-linear susceptibility scaling.

Base_Individual_Sample_Rate.description: Base rate of sampling for individuals. This rate equals the fraction of individuals in each node being sampled.

Age_Initialization_Distribution_Type.description: Method for initializing the age distribution in the simulated population. Possible values are: DISTRIBUTION_OFF - All individuals default to age 20-years-old. DISTRIBUTION_SIMPLE - Individual ages are drawn from a distribution whose functional form and parameters are specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layers: 'AgeDistributionFlag', 'AgeDistribution1', and 'AgeDistribution2'. DISTRIBUTION_COMPLEX - Individual ages are drawn from a piecewise linear distribution specified in the 'IndividualAttributes' demographics input layer 'AgeDistribution'.

Infectivity_Scale_Type.description: Alter infectivity by time or season.  Possible values are: CONSTANT_INFECTIVITY - No infectivity correction is applied.  FUNCTION_OF_TIME_AND_LATITUDE - Infectivity is corrected for approximate seasonal forcing.  The use of a seasonal infectivity correction is a proxy for the effects of varying climate.  From October through March, infectivity increases in the Northern Hemisphere and decreases in the Southern Hemisphere.  From April through September, the trend reverses.  Regions closer to the equator have reduced forcing compared to temperate regions.  This is not a substitute for the weather-driven vector dynamics of vector-borne and malaria simulations.  FUNCTION_OF_CLIMATE - Allows infectivity to be modulated by weather directly, for example, relative humidity in airborne simulations or rainfall in environmental simulations.  There is no default climate dependence enabled for generic simulations.  EXPONENTIAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME - To facilitate certain burn-in scenarios, infectivity ramps up from zero at the beginning of the simulation according to the functional form, 1-exp(-rate*time), where the rate is specified by the parameter Infectivity_Scaling_Rate.

Infectivity_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Only used or needed when Infectivity_Scale_Type is set to SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.  Sets the amplitude of sinusoidal variations in Base_Infectivity.

Infectivity_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Phase.description: Only used or needed when Infectivity_Scale_Type is set to SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.  Sets the phase of sinusoidal variations in Base_Infectivity.

Infectivity_Exponential_Baseline.description: Multiplier on base_infectivity at simtime = 0 for Infectivity_Scale_Type = EXPONENTIAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.

Infectivity_Exponential_Delay.description: Sets delay before infectivity begins to ramp up for Infectivity_Scale_Type = EXPONENTIAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME

Infectivity_Exponential_Rate.description: Sets the rate ofexponential approach to full infectivity after the delay for Infectivity_Scale_Type = EXPONENTIAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME

Infectivity_Boxcar_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Fractional increase in R0 during high infectivity season, when Infectivity_Scale_Type is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Infectivity_Boxcar_Forcing_Start_Time.description: Beginning of high infectivity season, when Infectivity_Scale_Type is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Infectivity_Boxcar_Forcing_End_Time.description: End of high infectivity season, when Infectivity_Scale_Type is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Animal_Reservoir_Type.description: Configures whether there is an animal reservoir and how the risk of zoonosis in configured. Use of the animal reservoir sets a low constant baseline of infectivity beyond what is present in the human population. It allows a more random introduction of cases in continuous time, which is more applicable for various situations such as zoonosis. Possible values are: NO_ZOONOSIS, CONSTANT_ZOONOSIS where the daily rate of zoonotic infection is configured by the parameter Zoonosis_Rate, and ZOONOSIS_FROM_DEMOGRAPHICS where the zoonosis rate is additionally scaled by the node-specific Zoonosis value in the NodeAttributes section of a demographics overlay file.  See Zoonosis_Rate.

Zoonosis_Rate.description: The daily rate of zoonotic infection per individual when the Animal_Reservoir_Type parameter is set to either CONSTANT_ZOONOSIS or ZOONOSIS_FROM_DEMOGRAPHICS.

x_Other_Mortality.description: Multiplier for scaling mortality from causes other than disease being simulated.

Set the distribution under IndividualAttributes using PrevalenceDistributionFlag, PrevalenceDistribution1, and PrevalenceDistribution2.

Enable_Birth.description: Set to 1 to enable individuals to be added to the simulation by birth.

If set to 1, you must indicate the type of distribution to use for immunity in the configuration parameter Immunity_Initialization_Distribution_Type and the distribution values in the demographics file.

Enable_Maternal_Infection_Transmission.description: Set to 1 to account for infection of infants at birth by infected mothers. Set to 0 to assume that infection is not transmitted by mothers to infants at birth.

Maternal_Infection_Transmission_Probabil.description: Probability of transmission of infection from mother to infant at birth. Relevant only if Enable_Maternal_Infection_Transmission is set to 1. Note: This parameter should be set to 0 and ignored for malaria and vector simulations.

DEMOGRAPHIC_DEP_RATE - Scales the female population within fertility age ranges to determine the birth rate. INDIVIDUAL_PREGNANCIES - Results in a similar birth rate as DEMOGRAPHIC_DEP_RATE, but pregnancies are assigned on an individual basis and result in a 40-week pregnancy for a specific individual with a birth at the end, INDIVIDUAL_PREGNANCIES_BY_URBAN_AND_AGE, and INDIVIDUAL_PREGNANCIES_BY_AGE_AND_YEAR.

Individual_Sampling_Type.description: Type of individual human sampling. Possible values are: TRACK_ALL, FIXED_SAMPLING, ADAPTED_SAMPLING_BY_POPULATION_SIZE, ADAPTED_SAMPLING_BY_AGE_GROUP, and ADAPTED_SAMPLING_BY_AGE_GROUP_AND_POP_SIZE.

Immune_Threshold_For_Downsampling.description: Threshold on acquisition immunity at which to apply immunity dependent downsampling.  Only matters when Individual_Sampling_Type is set to ADAPTED_SAMPLING_BY_IMMUNE_STATE.

Sample_Rate_Birth.description: Relative of relative sampling for births for age-adapted sampling.

Sample_Rate_0_18mo.description: Relative sampling rate for infants for the 0-18-month age group for age-adapted sampling.

Sample_Rate_18mo_4yr.description: Relative sampling rate for children in the age group 18 months to 4 years for age-adapted sampling.

Sample_Rate_5_9.description: Relative sampling rate for children in the age group 5-9 years for age-adapted sampling.

Sample_Rate_10_14.description: Relative sampling rate for children in the age group 10-14 years for age-adapted sampling.

Sample_Rate_15_19.description: Relative sampling rate for adolescents in the age group 15-19 years for age-adapted sampling.

Sample_Rate_20_Plus.description: Relative sampling rate for young adults in the age group 20 years or greater for age-adapted sampling.

Max_Node_Population_Samples.description: Number of individuals when the sampling rate starts dropping to the rate of adapted sampling by population size.

Population_Scale_Type.description: Either use the initial population specified in the demographics input file or a fixed scaling of this value based on the population scaling factor parameter. Possible values are: USE_INPUT_FILE and FIXED_SCALING.

Base_Population_Scale_Factor.description: If Population_Scale_Type is set to FIXED_SCALING, the initial simulation population is uniformly scaled over the entire area to adjust for historical or future population density.

Possible values are:  CONSTANT_INFECTIVITY and SATURATING_FUNCTION_OF_DENSITY.   Note: Sparsely populated areas have a lower infectivity, while densely populated areas have a higher infectivity which rises to saturate at the Base_Infectivity value.
