x_Birth.description: Multiplier of birth rate from input demographics file.

Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence.description: Allows for time dependence in the birth rate.  Available values are NONE, SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME, ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Birth_Rate_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Only used or needed when Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence is equal to SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.  Sets the amplitude of sinusoidal variations in birth rate.

Birth_Rate_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Phase.description: Only used or needed when Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence is equal to SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.  Sets the phase of sinusoidal variations in birth rate.

Birth_Rate_Boxcar_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Fractional increase in birth rate during high birth season, when Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Birth_Rate_Boxcar_Forcing_Start_Time.description: Beginning of high birth rate season, when Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Birth_Rate_Boxcar_Forcing_End_Time.description: End of high birth rate season, when Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Report_Sabin_Wild_Phenotype_As_Wild.description: Changes categorization from VDPV to WPV for reporting based on phenotype.

Enable_Contact_Tracing.description: Set to false to override genomes to enumerate infections for a WPV outbreak. Infections are only traced up to the number of substrains, although disease transmission continues as normal. In this mode, the evolution algorithm increments the substrain value of any infection by 1. Warning: This parameter applies to WPV outbreaks only. Do not use for VDPV simulations.

Default_Antigen.description: Poliovirus type for simulations with straintracking disabled.

Default_Genome.description: Poliovirus genome for simulations with straintracking disabled. Caution: Although this parameter currently has an upper bound of 1000 in the user interface you must not use values above 255. This parameter is used as an index into the values provided for substrainRelativeInfectivityString_VDPV1, substrainRelativeInfectivityString_VDPV2, and substrainRelativeInfectivityString_VDPV3, which are sized based on the number_substrains parameter, limited to 256.

Paralytic_Case_Mortality.description: Probability that a paralytic case is fatal.

Evolution_Polio_WPV_Linear_Rate.description: Rate of mutation fixation in the WPV genome, in sites per day.

Evolution_Polio_Sabin1_Linear_Rate.description: Rate of fixation of reversions for Sabin1, in sites per day.

Evolution_Polio_Sabin2_Linear_Rate.description: Rate of fixation of reversions for Sabin2, in sites per day.

Evolution_Polio_Sabin3_Linear_Rate.description: Rate of fixation of reversions for Sabin3, in sites per day.

Evolution_Polio_Immune_Rate.description: Rate of mutation fixation in the VDPV genome, in sites per day.

Evolution_Polio_Halfmax_Reversion.description: Reversion level at which mutation rate declines to half of maximum by Michaelis-Menton kinetics.

x_Population_Immunity.description: Multiplier (dimensionless) for initial population immunity. This value represents the fraction of individuals exposed to vaccination programs before the simulation begins. Note: This parameter has no effect on campaigns applied in the simulation domain.

Mucosal_Immunogenicity_IPV.description: The mucosal immunogenicity of IPV relative to OPV.

Mucosal_Immunogenicity_IPV_OPVExposed.description: The mucosal immunogenicity of IPV relative to OPV on OPV-exposed individuals.

Neutralization_Time_Tau.description: Virus neutralization time constant in days.

Paralytic_Immunity_Titer.description: Serum Nab protective threshold for paralysis.

Waning_Humoral_Rate_Fast.description: Exponential decay rate per day of neutralizing antibody titer that applied to the waning_humoral_fast_fraction.

Waning_Humoral_Rate_Slow.description: Exponential decay rate per day of neutralizing antibody titer that applies to the (1-waning_humoral_fast_fraction).

Waning_Humoral_Fast_Fraction.description: Fraction of weight given to the humoral fast decay rate.

Waning_Mucosal_Rate_Fast.description: Exponential decay rate per day of neutralizing antibody titer that applies to the waning_mucosal_fast_fraction.

Waning_Mucosal_Rate_Slow.description: Exponential decay rate per day of neutralizing antibody titer that applies to the (1-waning_mucosal_fast_fraction).

Waning_Mucosal_Fast_Fraction.description: Fraction of weight given to the mucosal fast decay rate.

Acquire_Rate_Default_Polio.description: Fraction of virus acquired from the mixing pool by default, used when the mixing pool option is disabled or both transmission options are on.

Maternal_log2NAb_mean.description: mean of log2 neutralizing antibodies in mothers

Maternal_log2NAb_std.description: std deviation of log2 neutralizing antibodies in mothers

Maternal_Ab_Halflife.description: half life in days for maternal neutralizing antibodies

Report_Event_Recorder_Ignore_Events_In_L.description: If this flag is set to true, all events listed in Report_Event_Recorder_Events will be ignored. If it is set to false, all events will be recorded.

Report_Event_Recorder_Events.description: The list of events to include or exclude in the ReportEventRecorder.csv output file. This is available for both STI_SIM and HIV_SIM, but HIV_SIM simulations will have additional columns.

Report_Event_Recorder_Individual_Propert.description: Fraction of individuals in the target demographic that will receive this intervention.

Report_HIV_Event_Channels_List.description: This is the list of events included in the InsetChart report. If events are specified with this parameter, the InsetChart will include a channel for each event listed. If no events are listed, a 'Number of Events' channel will display the total number of all events that occurred during the simulation.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Start_Year.description: The beginning calendar year that will be collected by the ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv report.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Stop_Year.description: The ending calendar year that will be collected by the HIVByAgeAndGender.csv report.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Collect_Circum.description: When set to 1, the ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv output file will have separate rows for those who do or do not have the MaleCircumcision intervention, as well as an additional column with 0 and 1 indicating whether the row corresponds to those who are or are not circumcised. Setting this to 1 will thus double the number of rows in ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Collect_HIV_Da.description: When set to 1, the ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv output file will have separate rows for those who do or do not have the ART intervention, as well as an additional column with 0 and 1 indicating whether the row corresponds to those who are or are not on ART. Setting this to 1 will thus double the number of rows in ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Collect_IP_Dat.description: TBD-When set to 1, the ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv output file will have separate rows for those with different Individual Property values, as well as an additional column for each Individual Property indicating which row corresponds to which value of that Individual Property. Setting this to 1 will typically increase by severalfold the number of rows in ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Collect_Interv.description: Takes a JSON list of strings in square braces that stratifies the population by adding a column of 0s and 1s depending on whether or not the person has the indicated intervention. This only works for interventions that remain with a person for a period of time, such as ART, VMMC, vaccine/PrEP, or a delay state in the cascade of care. You can name the intervention by adding a parameter Intervention_Name in the campaign file, and then give this parameter the same Intervention_Name. This allows you to have multiple types of vaccines, VMMCs, etc., but to only stratify on the type you want.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Stratify_Infec.description: When set to 1, the ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv output file will separate the count of the number of infected individuals by CD4 stratum. When set to 0, the number of infected individuals are aggregated into one column regardless of CD4 count.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Has_Interventi.description: This parameter is deprecated and has been replaced with Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Collect_Intervention_Data.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Event_Counter_.description: This list allows the user to add additional columns to the ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv output files counting the number of times an intervention with the corresponding Distributed_Event_Trigger has been distributed.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Add_Relationsh.description: When set to 1, the ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv output file will contain data by relationship type on population currently in a relationship and ever in a relationship.  A sum of those in two or more partnerships and also of the lifetime number of relationships in each bin will be included.

Report_HIV_Infection_Start_Year.description: The beginning calendar year specified for the HIVInfection.csv report.

Report_HIV_Infection_Stop_Year.description: The ending calendar year specified for the HIVInfection.csv report.

Disease_Susceptible_Report_Poliovirus_Ty.description: The serotype which is used to report infected individuals who are susceptible to paralysis: 0-2: WPV1-3, 3-5:VDPV1-3.

Report_Event_Recorder_Ignore_Events_In_L.description: If this flag is set to true, all events listed in Report_Event_Recorder_Events will be ignored. If it is set to false, all events will be recorded.

Report_Event_Recorder_Events.description: The list of events to include or exclude in the ReportEventRecorder.csv output file. This is available for both STI_SIM and HIV_SIM, but HIV_SIM simulations will have additional columns.

Report_Event_Recorder_Individual_Propert.description: Fraction of individuals in the target demographic that will receive this intervention.

Enable_Default_Reporting.description: Enables and disables the default InsetChart.json report.

Enable_Demographics_Reporting.description: Outputs demographic summary data and age-binned reports to file.

Report_Event_Recorder.description: Enables or disables the ReportEventRecorder.csv report.

Enable_Spatial_Output.description: Use value 0 to disable all spatial output channels. Use value 1 to enable spatial output of all channels listed in the array parameter: Spatial_Output_Channels.  For full documentation of spatial output channels, please see the online documentation.

Enable_Property_Output.description: Use value 0 to disable Individual_Property reports (separate file). Use value 1 to enable.

Campaign_Filename.description: Path of the simulation campaign file.  This configuration file defines campaign related settings and thus, is an optional file, only required when interventions are part of the simulation.

Load_Balance_Filename.description: Path to input file used when a static load balancing scheme is selected.

Run_Number.description: Sets the random number seed through a bit manipulation process for USE_PSEUDO_DES. When running a multi-core simulation, combines with processor rank to produce independent random number streams for each process.

Enable_Demographics_Reporting.description: Outputs demographic summary data and age-binned reports to file.

Enable_Property_Output.description: Use value 0 to disable Individual_Property reports (separate file). Use value 1 to enable.

PFA_Cum_Prob_Selection_Threshold.description: This parameter serves to minimize the extent to which relationships with unlikely age gaps are formed. These unlikely relationships could be generated due to lack of diversity in the PFA. Within the algorithm, males pick from amongst the available females by age bin, weighted by the conditional of the joint_probability matrix given the male age bin.  If the sum of the probabilities in the female age bins that are not empty is below this threshold, the male will wait till the next update. Setting this parameter to a value near 1 dramatically increases the delay that individuals well experience in seeking relationships. Setting this parameter to 0 disables the feature.

Enable_Immune_Decay.description: Set to 1 if immunity decays after an infection clears. Set to 0 if recovery from the disease confers complete immunity for life.

Acquisition_Blocking_Immunity_Decay_Rate.description: Rate at which acquisition-blocking immunity decays after the initial period indicated by the base acquisition-blocking immunity offset. Relevant only when Enable_Immunity and Enable_Immune_Decay parameters are set to 1.

Transmission_Blocking_Immunity_Decay_Rat.description: Rate at which transmission-blocking immunity decays after the base transmission-blocking immunity offset period. Relevant only when Enable_Immunity and Enable_Immune_Decay parameters are set to 1.

Mortality_Blocking_Immunity_Decay_Rate.description: Rate at which mortality-blocking immunity decays after the mortality-blocking immunity offset period. Relevant only when Enable_Immunity and Enable_Immune_Decay parameters are set to 1.

Immunity_Acquisition_Factor.description: Multiplicative reduction in probability of reacquiring the disease. Relevant only when Enable_Immunity and Enable_Immune_Decay parameters are set to 1.

Immunity_Transmission_Factor.description: Multiplicative reduction in probability of transmitting infection after getting re-infected. Relevant only when Enable_Immunity and Enable_Immune_Decay parameters are set to 1.

Immunity_Mortality_Factor.description: Multiplicative reduction in probability of dying from infection after getting re-infected. Relevant only when Enable_Immunity and Enable_Immune_Decay parameters are set to 1.

Acquisition_Blocking_Immunity_Duration_B.description: Number of days after infection until acquisition-blocking immunity begins to decay. Relevant only when Enable_Immunity and Enable_Immune_Decay parameters are set to 1.

Transmission_Blocking_Immunity_Duration_.description: Number of days after infection until transmission-blocking immunity begins to decay. Relevant only when Enable_Immunity and Enable_Immune_Decay parameters are set to 1.

Mortality_Blocking_Immunity_Duration_Bef.description: Number of days after infection until mortality-blocking immunity begins to decay. Relevant only when Enable_Immunity and Enable_Immune_Decay parameters are set to 1.

Enable_Maternal_Protection.description: Boolean value; setting true enables maternal protection as defined by Maternal_Protection_Type

Maternal_Protection_Type.description: Enumeration of maternal protection types. Possible values are: NONE, LINEAR_FRACTIONAL, LINEAR_BINARY, SIGMOID_FRACTIONAL, SIGMOID_BINARY.

Maternal_Linear_Slope.description: Slope parameter describing the rate of waning for maternal protection, must be positive. The per-day increase in susceptibility.

Maternal_Linear_SusZero.description: Initial level of maternal protection at age = 0, given as susceptibility. A value of 0.0 implies total protection, a value of 1.0 implies no protection.

Maternal_Sigmoid_SteepFac.description: Steepness factor describing the rate of waning for maternal protection, must be positive. Small values imply rapid waning.

Maternal_Sigmoid_HalfMaxAge.description: Age in days that the level of maternal protection is half of its initial value.

Maternal_Sigmoid_SusInit.description: Initial level of maternal protection at age = -INF, given as susceptibility. A value of 0.0 implies total protection, a value of 1.0 implies no protection.

TB_Immune_Loss_Fraction.description: Fraction of individuals that lose immunity with time.

TB_Smear_Positive_Fraction_Child.description: Fraction of active cases in children (under age 15) that are smear-positive. The sum of TB_Smear_Positive_Fraction_Child and TB_Extrapulmonary_Fraction_Child must be less than or equal to 1. The fraction of smear-negative children is 1 - ( TB_Smear_Positive_Fraction_Child + TB_Extrapulmonary_Fraction_Child ).

TB_Smear_Positive_Fraction_Adult.description: Fraction of active cases in adults (age 15 and over) that are smear-positive. The sum of TB_Smear_Positive_Fraction_Adult and TB_Extrapulmonary_Fraction_Adult must be less than or equal to 1. The fraction of smear-negative adults is 1 - ( TB_Smear_Positive_Fraction_Adult + TB_Extrapulmonary_Fraction_Adult ).

TB_Extrapulmonary_Fraction_Child.description: Fraction of active cases in children (under age 15) that are extrapulmonary. The sum of TB_Smear_Positive_Fraction_Child and TB_Extrapulmonary_Fraction_Child must be less than or equal to 1.

TB_Extrapulmonary_Fraction_Adult.description: Fraction of active cases in adults (age 15 or over) that are extrapulmonary. The sum of TB_Smear_Positive_Fraction_Adult and TB_Extrapulmonary_Fraction_Adult must be less than or equal to 1.

TB_Fast_Progressor_Fraction_Type.description: enable fast progressor fraction by age or social determinants like poverty

TB_Fast_Progressor_Fraction_Child.description: Fraction of children (under age 15) that are fast-progressors.

TB_Fast_Progressor_Fraction_Adult.description: Fraction of adults (age 15 or over) that are fast-progressors.

TB_Latent_Cure_Rate.description: The mean rate at which individuals progress from a latently infected state to a cured (uninfected) state. This rate is added to either the TB_Fast_Progressor_Rate or the TB_Slow_Progressor_Rate to determine total_rate of the latently infected state (depending on whether the individual is a fast-progressor or slow-progressor, respectively), then the ratio of TB_Latent_Cure_Rate to total_rate is calculated. This ratio determines the probability that a latently infected individual will go to a cured state after a mean duration of 1 / total_rate.

TB_Fast_Progressor_Rate.description: The mean rate at which individuals who are fast-progressors progress from a latently infected state to an active presymptomatic state. This rate is added to the TB_Latent_Cure_Rate to determine total_rate of the latently infected state, then the ratio of TB_Fast_Progressor_Rate to the total_rate is calculated. This ratio determines the probability that a latently infected fast-progressor will go to an active presymptomatic state after a mean duration of 1 / total_rate.

TB_Slow_Progressor_Rate.description: The mean rate at which individuals who are slow-progressors progress from a latently infected state to an active presymptomatic state. This rate is added to the TB_Latent_Cure_Rate to determine total_rate of the latently infected state, then the ratio of TB_Slow_Progressor_Rate to the total_rate is calculated. This ratio determines the probability that a latently infected fast-progressor will go to an active presymptomatic state after a mean duration of 1 / total_rate.

TB_Active_Cure_Rate.description: The mean rate at which active symptomatic individuals progress to a cured (uninfected) state. In the absence of treatment, this rate is added to TB_Inactivation_Rate and TB_Active_Mortality_Rate to determine the total_rate of the active smear-positive state, then the ratio of TB_Active_Cure_Rate to total_rate determines the probability that an actively infected individual will go to a cured state after a mean duration of 1 / total_rate.

TB_Inactivation_Rate.description: The mean rate at which active symptomatic (smear-positive, smear-negative, and extrapulmonary) individuals progress to an inactivated (latently infected) state. In the absence of treatment, this rate is added to TB_Active_Cure_Rate and TB_Active_Mortality_Rate to determine the total_rate of the active symptomatic state, then the ratio of TB_Active_Cure_Rate to total_rate determines the probability that an active syptomatic individual will go to a latently infected state after a mean duration of 1 / total_rate.

TB_Active_Mortality_Rate.description: The mean rate at which active smear-positive individuals die from TB disease. In the absence of treatment, this rate is added to TB_Active_Cure_Rate and TB_Inactivation_Rate to determine the total_rate of the active smear-positive state, then the ratio of TB_Active_Mortality_Rate to total_rate determines the probability that an active smear-positive individual will die from TB disease after a mean duration of 1 / total_rate.

TB_Extrapulmonary_Mortality_Multiplier.description: A constant by which TB_Active_Mortality_Rate is multiplied to give the mortality rate of active extrapulmonary individuals. In the absence of treatment, the product is added to TB_Active_Cure_Rate and TB_Inactivation_Rate to determine the total_rate of the active extrapulmonary state, then the ratio of the aforementioned product to total_rate determines the probability that an active extrapulmonary individual will die from TB disease after mean duration of 1 / total_rate.

TB_Smear_Negative_Mortality_Multiplier.description: A constant by which TB_Active_Mortality_Rate is multiplied to give the mortality rate of active smear-negative individuals. In the absence of treatment, the product is added to TB_Active_Cure_Rate and TB_Inactivation_Rate to determine the total_rate of the active smear-negative state, then the ratio of the aforementioned product to total_rate determines the probability that an active smear-negative individual will die from TB disease after mean duration of 1 / total_rate.

TB_Active_Presymptomatic_Infectivity_Mul.description: A constant by which Base_Infectivity is multiplied to give the infectiousness of active presymptomatic individuals.

TB_Presymptomatic_Rate.description: The mean rate at which active presymptomatic individuals progress to an active symptomatic state. This rate is added to TB_Presymptomatic_Cure_Rate to determine total_rate of the active presymptomatic state, then the ratio of TB_Presymptomatic_Rate to total_rate is calculated. This ratio determines the probability that an active presymptomatic individual will go to active symptomatic disease after a mean duration of 1 / total_rate.

TB_Presymptomatic_Cure_Rate.description: The mean rate at which active presymptomatic individuals progress to a cured (uninfected) state. This rate is added to TB_Presymptomatic_Rate to determine total_rate of the active presymptomatic state, then the ratio of TB_Presymptomatic_Cure_Rate to total_rate is calculated. This ratio determines the probability that an active presymptomatic individual will go to a cured state after a mean duration of 1 / total_rate.

TB_Smear_Negative_Infectivity_Multiplier.description: A constant by which Base_Infectivity is multiplied to give the infectiousness of active smear-negative individuals.

TB_Drug_Efficacy_Multiplier_MDR.description: A constant by which drug efficacy parameters (TB_Drug_Inactivation_Rate and TB_Drug_Cure_Rate) are multiplied to give the efficacy of first-line drugs when given to individuals with MDR-TB. The value of 1 assumes equal efficacy for drug-sensitive TB and MDR-TB.

TB_Drug_Efficacy_Multiplier_Failed.description: A constant by which drug efficacy parameters (TB_Drug_Inactivation_Rate and TB_Drug_Cure_Rate) are multiplied to give the efficacy of first-line drugs when given to individuals who have failed treatment. The value of 1 assumes equal efficacy for treatment-naive and treatment-failed individuals.

TB_Drug_Efficacy_Multiplier_Relapsed.description: A constant by which drug efficacy parameters (TB_Drug_Inactivation_Rate and TB_Drug_Cure_Rate) are multiplied to give the efficacy of first-line drugs when given to individuals who have relapsed after treatment. The value of 1 assumes equal efficacy for treatment-naive and relapsed individuals.

TB_MDR_Fitness_Multiplier.description: A constant by which Base_Infectivity is multipled 1 to give the infectiousness of MDR-TB strains. The value of 1 assumes equal infectiousness of drug-sensitive TB and MDR-TB.

TB_Relapsed_to_Active_Rate.description: The mean rate at which relapsed individuals progress to an active symptomatic state. By default, the same value as the TB_Fast_Progressor_Rate is used.

TB_Active_Period_Distribution.description: Distribution for duration of active disease. For both EXPONENTIAL_DURATION and GAUSSIAN_DURATION, the mean is defined by total_rate which is the sum of TB_Inactivation_Rate and TB_Active_Mortality_Rate corrected for smear status. For GAUSSIAN_DURATION, an additional parameter TB_Active_Period_Std_Dev is used to provide a value for standard deviation.

TB_Active_Period_Std_Dev.description: When TB_Active_Period_Distribution is set to GAUSSIAN_DURATION, this parameter provides the value for standard deviation.

TB_CD4_Activation_Vector.description: Increased risk per time step of TB activation by CD4.

CoInfection_Mortality_Rate_On_ART.description: daily rate of death excess to TB when coinfected with HIV on ART

CoInfection_Mortality_Rate_Off_ART.description: daily rate of death excess to TB when coinfected with HIV off ART

TB_CD4_Infectiousness.description: Relative multiplicative increase in TB Infectiousness due to HIV positivity/CD4 decline

TB_CD4_Susceptibility.description: Relative increase in TB susceptibility due to HIV/CD4 decline

TB_CD4_Primary_Progression.description: proportion (i.e., multiplier)  increase in Primary Progression with by CD4

TB_CD4_Strata_Infectiousness_Susceptibil.description: CD4 strata defining decreases/increases in TB infectiousness and susceptibility

ART_Reactivation_Factor.description: Factor for ART reducing reactivation in HIV+

Report_Event_Recorder_Ignore_Events_In_L.description: If this flag is set to true, all events listed in Report_Event_Recorder_Events will be ignored. If it is set to false, all events will be recorded.

Report_Event_Recorder_Events.description: The list of events to include or exclude in the ReportEventRecorder.csv output file. This is available for both STI_SIM and HIV_SIM, but HIV_SIM simulations will have additional columns.

Report_Event_Recorder_Individual_Propert.description: Fraction of individuals in the target demographic that will receive this intervention.

Age_Dependent_Biting_Risk_Type.description: Type of functional form for age-dependent biting-risk.  Possible values are: OFF, LINEAR, SURFACE_AREA_DEPENDENT.

Newborn_Biting_Risk_Multiplier.description: For age-dependent biting risk type = linear; defines the y-intercept of the linear portion of the biting risk curve.

Use_Defaults.description: Set to true (1) if you don't want to have to specify all params for event coordinators and interventions. Use at own risk.

Start_Day.description: Day of the simulation to activate the event's event coordinator.

Nodeset_Config.description: The NodeSet describing the nodes covered by the event.

Event_Coordinator_Config.description: The configuration of the EventCoordinator to be instantiated.

Start_Year.description: Absolute year of the simulation to activate the event's event coordinator.  Internally converted to Start_Day using Base_Year and Simulation_Timestep.

Nodeset_Config.description: The NodeSet describing the nodes covered by the event.

Event_Coordinator_Config.description: The configuration of the EventCoordinator to be instantiated.

Distribution_Times.description: Vector of ints for simulation times at which distribution of events occurs in a CalendarEventCoordinator.

Distribution_Coverages.description: Vector of floats for fraction of individuals that will receive this intervention in a CalendarEventCoordinator.

Intervention_Config.description: The nested json of the actual intervention to be distributed by this event coordinator.

Target_Age_Min.description: Lower end of age targeted for intervention, in years.

Target_Age_Max.description: Upper end of age targeted for intervention, in years.

Target_Gender.description: Specify the gender restriction for the intervention. Defaults to All.

Property_Restrictions.description: Fraction of individuals in the target demographic that will receive this intervention.

Start_Day.description: The day to start distributing the intervention.

End_Day.description: The day to stop distributing the intervention. No interventions are distributed on this day or going forward.

Num_Targeted.description: The number of individuals to target with the intervention. Note that this value will be scaled up by the population scaling factor equal to Base_Population_Scale_Factor. If using this parameter, Num_Targeted_Males/Females must be empty.

Num_Targeted_Males.description: The number of male individuals to distribute interventions to during this time period. If using the parameter with Num_Targeted_Females to target specific genders, they both must be the same length, and Num_Targeted must be empty.

Num_Targeted_Females.description: The number of female individuals to distribute interventions to during this time period. If using the parameter with Num_Targeted_Males to target specific genders, they both must be the same length, and Num_Targeted must be empty.

Min.description: For the NChooserEventCoordinator, this parameter determines the minimum age, in years. An individual is considered in range if their age is greater than or equal to the minimum age and less than the maximum age, in floating point years of age.

Max.description: For the NChooserEventCoordinator, this parameter determines the maximum age, in years. An individual is considered in range if their age is greater than or equal to the minimum age and less than the maximum age, in floating point years of age.

Age_Ranges_Years.description: A list of age ranges that individuals must be in to qualify for an intervention. Each age range is a JSON object with a minimum and a maximum property. An individual is considered in range if their age is greater than or equal to the minimum age and less than the maximum age, in floating point years of age. It must have the same number of objects as Num_Targeted_XXX has elements.

<key>.description: Individual Property Key from demographics file.

<value>.description: Individual Property Value from demographics file.

Property_Restrictions_Within_Node.description: An array of key-value pairs that defines the properties individuals must have in order to be selected.

Distributions.description: The ordered list of elements defining when, to whom, and how many interventions to distribute.

Intervention_Config.description: The intervention to be distributed by NChooserEventCoordinator.

Start_Year.description: The year to start distributing the intervention. Start_year along with End_Year defines the time period to distribute the intervention. The intervention is evenly distributed between each time step in the time period.

End_Year.description: The year to stop distributing the intervention. End_Year along with Start_Year defines the time period to distribute the intervention. The intervention is evenly distributed between each time step in the time period.

Target_Disease_State.description: For the NChooserEventCoordinatorHIV, a two-dimensional array of particular disease states. To qualify for the intervention, an individual must have only one of the targeted disease states. An individual must have all of the disease states in the inner array. Possible values are: HIV_Positive HIV_Negative Tested_Positive Tested_Negative Male_Circumcision_Positive Male_Circumcision_Negative Has_Intervention Not_have_Intervention.

Target_Disease_State_Has_Intervention_Na.description: The name of the intervention to look for in an individual when using Has_Intervention or Not_have_Intervention in Target_Disease_State.

Num_Targeted.description: The number of individuals to target with the intervention. Note that this value will be scaled up by the population scaling factor equal to Base_Population_Scale_Factor. If using this parameter, Num_Targeted_Males/Females must be empty.

Num_Targeted_Males.description: The number of male individuals to distribute interventions to during this time period. If using the parameter with Num_Targeted_Females to target specific genders, they both must be the same length, and Num_Targeted must be empty.

Num_Targeted_Females.description: The number of female individuals to distribute interventions to during this time period. If using the parameter with Num_Targeted_Males to target specific genders, they both must be the same length, and Num_Targeted must be empty.

Min.description: For the NChooserEventCoordinator, this parameter determines the minimum age, in years. An individual is considered in range if their age is greater than or equal to the minimum age and less than the maximum age, in floating point years of age.

Max.description: For the NChooserEventCoordinator, this parameter determines the maximum age, in years. An individual is considered in range if their age is greater than or equal to the minimum age and less than the maximum age, in floating point years of age.

Age_Ranges_Years.description: A list of age ranges that individuals must be in to qualify for an intervention. Each age range is a JSON object with a minimum and a maximum property. An individual is considered in range if their age is greater than or equal to the minimum age and less than the maximum age, in floating point years of age. It must have the same number of objects as Num_Targeted_XXX has elements.

Start_Year.description: The year to start distributing the intervention. Start_year along with End_Year defines the time period to distribute the intervention. The intervention is evenly distributed between each time step in the time period.

End_Year.description: The year to stop distributing the intervention. End_Year along with Start_Year defines the time period to distribute the intervention. The intervention is evenly distributed between each time step in the time period.

Viral_Suppression.description: ART will suppress viral load and extend prognosis if true.

Days_To_Achieve_Viral_Suppression.description: The number of days after ART initiation over which infectiousness declines linearly until the ART_Viral_Suppression_Multiplier takes full effect.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If an individual's container has an intervention, set to 1 to prevent them from receiving another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention types.

Disqualifying_Properties.description: TBD-A list of Individual Property Key:Value pairs that cause an intervention to be aborted. Used to control the flow of health care access, e.g., to prevent the same individual from accessing health care via two different routes at the same time.

New_Property_Value.description: TBD-A marker associated with an intervention to indicate what the broad category of health care cascade to which an intervention belongs. This allows for additional control of the flow of health care, e.g., the use of Disqualifying_Properties to prevent simultaneous use of multiple pathways to care.

Base_Specificity.description: The specificity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals without the condition being tested receive a negative diagnostic test. When set to 1, the diagnostic always accurately reflects the lack of having the condition. When set to zero, then individuals who do not have the condition always receive a false-positive diagnostic test.

Base_Sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals with the condition being tested receive a positive diagnostic test. When set to 1, the diagnostic always accurately reflects the condition. When set to zero, then individuals who have the condition always receive a false-negative diagnostic test.

Treatment_Fraction.description: The fraction of positive diagnoses that are treated.

Days_To_Diagnosis.description: The number of days from test until diagnosis.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: The unit 'cost' assigned to the intervention. Setting Cost_To_Consumer to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Event_Or_Config.description: Specifies whether the current intervention distributes a nested intervention (the Config option) or an event will be broadcast which may trigger other interventions in the campaign file (the Event option). See event list.

Positive_Diagnosis_Event.description: The next health care event that occurs for individuals who test negative. This is only valid if Event_Or_Config is set to 'Event'.

Positive_Diagnosis_Config.description: The intervention distributed to individuals if they test positive. This is only valid if Event_Or_Config is set to 'Config'.

Drug_Type.description: Type of anti-malarial drug to distribute in a drugs intervention. Possible values are: Artemisinin (AR), Chloroquine (CQ), Quinine (QN), Sulfadoxine-Pyramethamine (SP), Primaquine (PQ), Artemether_Lumefantrine (AR_LM), Generic Transmission Blocking (TBD), Generic Pre-erythrocytic (PED), Tafenoquine (TQ).

Dosing_Type.description: Type of anti-malarial dosing to distribute in a drugs intervention. Possible values are: SingleDose, FullTreatmentCourse, Prophylaxis, SingleDoseWhenSymptom, FullTreatmentWhenSymptom, SingleDoseParasiteDetect, FullTreatmentParasiteDetect, SingleDoseNewDetectionTech, FullTreatmentNewDetectionTech.

Drug_Type.description: Drug_Type specifies the name of the drug treatment, such as DOTS or EmpiricTreatment, which can be useful for reporting from the simulation.

TB_Drug_Inactivation_Rate.description: This parameter, TB_Drug_Cure_Rate, TB_Drug_Relapse_Rate, and TB_Drug_Mortality_Rate, specify the daily probability of a change in the TB disease state during the course of treatment. The sum of these rates and the total duration of treatment specify the probability that any event occurs. If no event occurs, the individual fails drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Cure_Rate.description: This parameter, TB_Drug_Inactivation, TB_Drug_Relapse_Rate, and TB_Drug_Mortality_Rate specify the daily probability of a change in the TB disease state during the course of treatment. The sum of these rates and the total duration of treatment specify the probability that any event occurs. If no event occurs, the individual fails drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Resistance_Rate.description: This parameter determines the daily probability that an (HIV-) individual with drug-sensitive TB will acquire MDR-TB. Only individuals who return to the latent state or fail can acquire MDR-TB.

TB_Drug_Relapse_Rate.description: This parameter, TB_Drug_Inactivation, TB_Drug_Cure_Rate, and TB_Drug_Mortality_Rate specify the daily probability of a change in the TB disease state during the course of treatment. The sum of these rates and the total duration of treatment specify the probability that any event occurs. If no event occurs, the individual fails drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Mortality_Rate.description: This parameter, TB_Drug_Inactivation, TB_Drug_Relapse_Rate, and TB_Drug_Cure_Rate specify the daily probability of a change in the TB disease state during the course of treatment. The sum of these rates and the total duration of treatment specify the probability that any event occurs. If no event occurs, the individual fails drug treatment.

Reduced_Transmit.description: The reduced infectiousness when an individual is on drugs.

Primary_Decay_Time_Constant.description: The primary decay time constant of the decay profile.

Remaining_Doses.description: The remaining doses in an intervention, enter a negative number for unlimited doses.

Fraction_Defaulters.description: The fraction of individuals who will not finish their drug treatment.

Durability_Profile.description: The PKPD (pharmacokinetic) model type (FIXED_DURATION_CONSTANT_EFFECT or CONCENTRATION_VERSUS_TIME).  The latter conditionally loads some parameters as follows:  Drug_Cmax - Drug maximum concentration for a dosing is 0 to 10000  Drug_Vd - Volume of distribution for the drug is 0 to 10000  Drug_PKPD_c50 - Drug PKPD c50 for killing effects is 0 to 5000

Secondary_Decay_Time_Constant.description: The secondary decay time constant of the decay profile.

Drug_CMax.description: Drug maximum concentration for a dosing.

Drug_Vd.description: Volume of distribution for the drug.

Drug_Type_by_Property.description: A drug that is distributed to a specific group within the popuation (for example, individuals who are in the public health care system). The groups are defined in the demographics file using IndividualProperties. The drug type and values are defined in the configuration file using TB_Drug_Types_For_This_Sim and TB_Drug_Params.

Blocking_Config.description: The configuration of pre-feed mosquito repellency and waning for housing modification.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: Unit cost per vaccine (unamortized). The unit 'cost' assigned to the intervention. Setting Cost_To_Consumer to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Vaccine_Take_Age_Decay_Rate.description: This variable assumes that the vaccine take declines exponentially with age (in units of years). Vaccine_Take_Age_Decay_Rate specifies the rate of this exponential decline (in units of 1/years).

Vaccine_Take.description: This specifies the rate at which delivered vaccines will successfully stimulate an immune response and achieve the desired efficacy. If vaccine_take is set to 0.9, then with a 90 percent chance, the vaccine will start with the specified efficacy, and with a 10 percent chance it will have no efficacy at all.

Vaccine_Type.description: Type of vaccine to distribute in a vaccine intervention. Possible values are: - Generic - The vaccine can have all of "reduced_transmit", "reduced_acquire", and "reduced_mortality" fields and the vaccine will have both effects. - TransmissionBlocking - Specifies the fraction by which the infectivity of the infected and vaccinated Individual is reduced ("reduced_transmit"). - AcquisitionBlocking - Specifies the fraction by which the force of infection experienced by the vaccinated Individual is reduced ("reduced_acquire"). - MortalityBlocking - Specifies the fraction by which the disease-mortality rate of a vaccinated Individual is reduced ("reduced_mortality").

Efficacy_Is_Multiplicative.description: TBD-True implies that the vaccine efficacies are multiplied together, false implies additive.  This applies when the person is getting more than one vaccine.

Waning_Config.description: The configuration of drug-killing efficacy and waning.

Demographic_Coverage.description: Fraction of individuals in the target demographic that will receive this intervention.

Target_Demographic.description: The demographic group (from a list of possibles) targeted by this intervention (e.g., Infants).

Target_Age_Min.description: Lower end of age targeted for intervention, in years.

Target_Age_Max.description: Upper end of age targeted for intervention, in years.

Target_Gender.description: Specify the gender restriction for the intervention. Defaults to All.

Property_Restrictions.description: Fraction of individuals in the target demographic that will receive this intervention.

<key>.description: Individual Property Key from demographics file.

<value>.description: Individual Property Value from demographics file.

Property_Restrictions_Within_Node.description: Fraction of individuals in the target demographic that will receive this intervention.

Target_Residents_Only.description: If true, only distribute the intervention to those that claim the node as their residence - i.e. started in the node

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

Disqualifying_Properties.description: TBD-A list of Individual Property Key:Value pairs that cause an intervention to be aborted. Used to control the flow of health care access, e.g., to prevent the same individual from accessing health care via two different routes at the same time.

New_Property_Value.description: TBD-A marker associated with an intervention to indicate what the broad category of health care cascade to which an intervention belongs. This allows for additional control of the flow of health care, e.g., the use of Disqualifying_Properties to prevent simultaneous use of multiple pathways to care.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If an individual's container has an intervention, set to 1 to prevent them from receiving another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention types.

Broadcast_Event.description: The event that should occur at the end of the delay period.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

Event_Trigger.description: The name of the event to broadcast to selected nodes.

Include_My_Node.description: Set to 1 to broadcast the event to the current node.

Node_Selection_Type.description: The method by which to select nodes to receive the event. Options include: DISTANCE_ONLY: Nodes located within the distance specified by Max_Distance_To_Other_Nodes_Km are selected. MIGRATION_NODES_ONLY: Nodes that are local or regional are selected. DISTANCE_AND_MIGRATION: Nodes are selected using DISTANCE_ONLY and MIGRATION_NODES_ONLY criteria.

Max_Distance_To_Other_Nodes_Km.description: The maximum distance, in kilometers, to the destination node for the node to be selected. The location values used are those valued entered in the demographics. Only applies if Node_Selection_Type is either DISTANCE_ONLY or DISTANCE_AND_MIGRATION.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If an individual's container has an intervention, set to 1 to prevent them from receiving another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention types.

Disqualifying_Properties.description: TBD-A list of Individual Property Key:Value pairs that cause an intervention to be aborted. Used to control the flow of health care access, e.g., to prevent the same individual from accessing health care via two different routes at the same time.

New_Property_Value.description: TBD-A marker associated with an intervention to indicate what the broad category of health care cascade to which an intervention belongs. This allows for additional control of the flow of health care, e.g., the use of Disqualifying_Properties to prevent simultaneous use of multiple pathways to care.

Base_Specificity.description: The specificity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals without the condition being tested receive a negative diagnostic test. When set to 1, the diagnostic always accurately reflects the lack of having the condition. When set to zero, then individuals who do not have the condition always receive a false-positive diagnostic test.

Base_Sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals with the condition being tested receive a positive diagnostic test. When set to 1, the diagnostic always accurately reflects the condition. When set to zero, then individuals who have the condition always receive a false-negative diagnostic test.

Treatment_Fraction.description: The fraction of positive diagnoses that are treated.

Days_To_Diagnosis.description: The number of days from test until diagnosis.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: The unit 'cost' assigned to the intervention. Setting Cost_To_Consumer to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Low.description: The high end of the diagnostic level.

High.description: The low end of the diagnostic level.

Event.description: The user-defined name of the diagnostic event.

CD4_Thresholds.description: Used to associate ranges of CD4 counts with events that should occur for individuals whose CD4 counts fall into those ranges.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If an individual's container has an intervention, set to 1 to prevent them from receiving another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention types.

This allows for additional control of the flow of health care, e.g., the use of Disqualifying_Properties to prevent simultaneous use of multiple pathways to care.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: Unit cost per vaccine (unamortized). The unit 'cost' assigned to the intervention. Setting Cost_To_Consumer to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Distributed_Event_Trigger.description: The name of the event to be broadcast when the intervention is distributed to an individual.

Expired_Event_Trigger.description: The name of the event to be broadcast when the intervention expires.

Duration_To_Wait_Before_Revaccination.description: The length of time, in days, to wait before revaccinating an individual. After this time has passed, the individual can be revaccinated and if the first vaccine has not expired, the individual can receive the effect from both doses of the vaccine.

Vaccine_Take.description: This specifies the rate at which delivered vaccines will successfully stimulate an immune response and achieve the desired efficacy. If vaccine_take is set to 0.9, then with a 90 percent chance, the vaccine will start with the specified efficacy, and with a 10 percent chance it will have no efficacy at all.

Vaccine_Type.description: Type of vaccine to distribute in a vaccine intervention. Possible values are: - Generic - The vaccine can have all of "reduced_transmit", "reduced_acquire", and "reduced_mortality" fields and the vaccine will have both effects. - TransmissionBlocking - Specifies the fraction by which the infectivity of the infected and vaccinated Individual is reduced ("reduced_transmit"). - AcquisitionBlocking - Specifies the fraction by which the force of infection experienced by the vaccinated Individual is reduced ("reduced_acquire"). - MortalityBlocking - Specifies the fraction by which the disease-mortality rate of a vaccinated Individual is reduced ("reduced_mortality").

Efficacy_Is_Multiplicative.description: TBD-True implies that the vaccine efficacies are multiplied together, false implies additive.  This applies when the person is getting more than one vaccine.

Waning_Config.description: The configuration of drug-killing efficacy and waning.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If an individual's container has an intervention, set to 1 to prevent them from receiving another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention types.

This allows for additional control of the flow of health care, e.g., the use of Disqualifying_Properties to prevent simultaneous use of multiple pathways to care.

Coverage.description: Fraction of individuals receiving delayed distribution of configured interventions.

Delay_Distribution.description: Distribution of duration of delay period.  Supported values are: FIXED_DURATION UNIFORM_DURATION GAUSSIAN_DURATION EXPONENTIAL_DURATION.

Delay_Period.description: If a FIXED_DURATION is specified as the Delay_Distribution, add this parameter Delay_Period to directly specify the time delay (in number of days). If EXPONENTIAL_DURATION is specified as the Delay_Distribution, Delay_Period, represents the exponential rate that describes the distribution of the time delay (in units of 1/days).

Delay_Period_Min.description: If a UNIFORM_DURATION is specified as the Delay_Distribution, add this parameter Delay_Period_Min to directly specify the minimum time delay (in number of days).

Delay_Period_Max.description: If a UNIFORM_DURATION is specified as the Delay_Distribution, add this parameter Delay_Period_Max to directly specify the maximum time delay (in number of days).

Delay_Period_Mean.description: If a GAUSSIAN_DURATION is specified as the Delay_Distribution, add this parameter Delay_Period_Mean to directly specify the mean time delay (in number of days).

Delay_Period_Std_Dev.description: If a GAUSSIAN_DURATION is specified as the Delay_Distribution, add this parameter Delay_Period_Std_Dev to specify the standard deviation describing the Gaussian distribution (in number of days).

Delay_Period_Scale.description: If a WEIBULL_DURATION is specified as the Delay_Distribution, add this parameter Delay_Period_Scale to specify scale (lambda > 0) of the distribution (in days).

Delay_Period_Shape.description: If a WEIBULL_DURATION is specified as the Delay_Distribution, add this parameter Delay_Period_Shape to specify the shape (kappa > 0) of the distribution.

Actual_IndividualIntervention_Configs.description: Array of nested interventions to be distributed at end of delay period to covered fraction.

Event_Or_Config.description: Specifies whether the current intervention distributes a nested intervention (the Config option) or an event will be broadcast which may trigger other interventions in the campaign file (the Event option). See event list.

Negative_Diagnosis_Event.description: Specifies what state transition event will occur if an individual tests negative.

Defaulters_Event.description: Specifies what state transition event will occur if an individual receives the test but does not return for the test results.

Negative_Diagnosis_Config.description: The intervention distributed to individuals, if they test negative. This is only valid if Event_Or_Config is set to Config.

Defaulters_Config.description: The intervention distributed to individuals if they receive the test but subsequently defaults (they do not return to get the test result). This is only valid if Event_Or_Config is set to Config.

Positive_Diagnosis_Event.description: The next health care event that occurs for individuals who test negative. This is only valid if Event_Or_Config is set to 'Event'.

Positive_Diagnosis_Config.description: The intervention distributed to individuals if they test positive. This is only valid if Event_Or_Config is set to 'Config'.

Threshold.description: If the individual's CD4 at the last recorded HIVDrawBlood is below the time-varying threshold, then the test will be positive.

If_Active_TB.description: Time-varying CD4 threshold for individuals that have active TB, as indicated by their Individual Properties. Applies to active TB individuals whose last recorded CD4 is above the current general population threshold.

If_Pregnant.description: Time-varying CD4 threshold for pregnant individuals.  Applies to pregnant individuals whose last recorded CD4 is above the current general population threshold.

Individual_Property_Active_TB_Key.description: The Individual Property key ('HasActiveTB') to determine whether the individual has TB.

Individual_Property_Active_TB_Value.description: The Individual Property value ('Yes') to determine whether the individual has TB.

Negative_Diagnosis_Event.description: The next health care event that occurs for individuals who test negative. This is only valid if Event_Or_Config is set to 'Event'.

Adult_Treatment_Age.description: The age that delineates adult patients from pediatric patients for the purpose of treatment eligibility. Patients younger than this age may be eligible on the basis of their pediatric patient status.

Values.description: An array of values to match the defined Times.

Adult_By_WHO_Stage.description: Determines the WHO stage at or above which adults are eligible for ART.

Adult_By_TB.description: Determines the WHO stage at or above which adults having active TB (via individual property Has_Active_TB) are eligible for ART.

Adult_By_Pregnant.description: Determines the WHO stage at or above which pregnant adults are eligible for ART.

Child_Treat_Under_Age_In_Years_Threshold.description: Determines the age at which children are eligible for ART regardless of CD4, WHO stage, or other factors.

Child_By_WHO_Stage.description: Determines the WHO stage at or above which children are eligible for ART.

Child_By_TB.description: Determines the WHO stage at or above which children having active TB (via individual property Has_Active_TB) are eligible for ART.

Individual_Property_Active_TB_Value.description: The Individual Property value ('Yes') to determine whether the individual has TB.

New_Property_Value.description: TBD-A marker associated with an intervention to indicate what the broad category of health care cascade to which an intervention belongs. This allows for additional control of the flow of health care, e.g., the use of Disqualifying_Properties to prevent simultaneous use of multiple pathways to care.

Expiration_Period.description: A fixed time period, in days, after which the Broadcast_On_Expiration_Event occurs instead of the Broadcast_Event. Only applied if the Expiration_Period occurs earlier than the end of the delay period. For example, if loss to follow-up occurs at a high rate for the first 6 months of care, and then later transitions to a lower rate, then the Expiration_Period should be set to 183 days and Broadcast_On_Expiration_Event can link to another delay intervention with a longer average delay time until LTFU. If LTFU does not occur in the first 6 months, then the expiration will allow the first rate to give way to the post-6-month rate.

Muxer_Name.description: A name used to identify the delay and check whether individuals have entered it multiple times. If the same name is used at multiple points in the health care process, then the number of entries is combined when Max_Entries is applied.

Max_Entries.description: The maximum number of times the individual can be registered with the HIVMuxer delay. Determines what should happen if an individual reaches the HIVMuxer stage of health care multiple times. For example, registering for an exponential delay two times effectively doubles the rate of leaving the delay. Setting Max_Entries to 1 prevents the rate from doubling.

Broadcast_Event.description: The event that should occur at the end of the delay period.

Broadcast_On_Expiration_Event.description: If the delay intervention expires before arriving at the end of the delay period, this specifies the event that should occur. For example, if loss to follow-up occurs at a high rate for the first 6 months of care, and then later transitions to a lower rate, then the Expiration_Period should be set to 183 days and Broadcast_On_Expiration_Event can link to another delay intervention with a longer average delay time until LTFU. If LTFU does not occur in the first 6 months, then the expiration will allow the first rate to give way to the post-6-month rate.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If an individual's container has an intervention, set to 1 to prevent them from receiving another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention types.

Disqualifying_Properties.description: TBD-A list of Individual Property Key:Value pairs that cause an intervention to be aborted. Used to control the flow of health care access, e.g., to prevent the same individual from accessing health care via two different routes at the same time.

New_Property_Value.description: TBD-A marker associated with an intervention to indicate what the broad category of health care cascade to which an intervention belongs. This allows for additional control of the flow of health care, e.g., the use of Disqualifying_Properties to prevent simultaneous use of multiple pathways to care.

Base_Specificity.description: The specificity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals without the condition being tested receive a negative diagnostic test. When set to 1, the diagnostic always accurately reflects the lack of having the condition. When set to zero, then individuals who do not have the condition always receive a false-positive diagnostic test.

Base_Sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals with the condition being tested receive a positive diagnostic test. When set to 1, the diagnostic always accurately reflects the condition. When set to zero, then individuals who have the condition always receive a false-negative diagnostic test.

Treatment_Fraction.description: The fraction of positive diagnoses that are treated.

Days_To_Diagnosis.description: The number of days from test until diagnosis.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: The unit 'cost' assigned to the intervention. Setting Cost_To_Consumer to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Interpolation_Order.description: When set to zero, interpolation between values in the Time_Value_Map is zero-order ('staircase'). When set to 1, interpolation between values in the Time_Value_Map is linear. The final value is held constant for all times after the last time specified in the Time_Value_Map.

Female_Multiplier.description: Allows for the probabilities in the Time_Value_Map to be different for males and females, by multiplying the female probabilities by a constant value.

Default_Value.description: The probability of positive 'diagnosis' if the intervention is used before the earliest specified time in the Time_Value_Map.

Values.description: An array of values to match the defined Times.

Time_Value_Map.description: A JSON structure containing one array of Times and one for Values, which allows for a time-variable probability that can take on any shape over time. When queried at a simulation year corresponding to one of the listed Times, it returns the corresponding Value. When queried earlier than the first listed Time, it returns the Default value. When queried in between listed Times, it either returns the value for the most recent past time (when Interpolation_Order is 0) or linearly interpolates Values between Times (when Interpolation_Order is 1). When queried after the last Time in the list, it returns the last Value. The Times and Values must be of equal length, and can consist of a single value. Times must monotonically increase.

Negative_Diagnosis_Event.description: The next health care event that occurs for individuals who test negative. This is only valid if Event_Or_Config is set to 'Event'.

Positive_Diagnosis_Event.description: The next health care event that occurs for individuals who test negative. This is only valid if Event_Or_Config is set to 'Event'.

Positive_Diagnosis_Config.description: The intervention distributed to individuals if they test positive. This is only valid if Event_Or_Config is set to 'Config'.

Ramp_Rate.description: The slope of the infection point in the sigmoid trend over time. A Rate of 1 sets the slope to a 25% change in probability per year.

If true (1), a missed dose (by applying the probability) will result in no further doses, that is, a miss means you have dropped out altogether.

Age.description: An array of ages (in days). In IVCalendar, there is a list of actual interventions where the distribution is dependent on whether the individual's age matches the next date in the calendar.

Probability.description: The probability of an individual receiving the list of actual interventions at the corresponding age.

Calendar.description: An array of ages days and probability of receiving an intervention.

Durations.description: TBD-Durations to apply import pressure over.

Number_Cases_Per_Node.description: Number of new cases of Outbreak to import (per node). This will increase population. There is no control over demographics of these individuals.

Import_Age.description: Age (in days) of infected import cases

Setting Cost_To_Consumer to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Prime_Acquire.description: Specifies priming effect on acquisition immunity for naive individuals (without natural or vaccine-derived immunity) for a multi-effect booster vaccine.

Prime_Transmit.description: Specifies priming effect on transmission immunity for naive individuals (without natural or vaccine-derived immunity) for a multi-effect booster vaccine.

Prime_Mortality.description: Specifies priming effect on mortality immunity for naive individuals (without natural or vaccine-derived immunity) for a multi-effect booster vaccine.

Boost_Acquire.description: Specifies boosting effect on acquisition immunity for naive individuals (without natural or vaccine-derived immunity) for a multi-effect booster vaccine.  This does not replace current immunity, it builds multiplicatively on top of it.

Boost_Transmit.description: Specifies boosting effect on transmission immunity for naive individuals (without natural or vaccine-derived immunity) for a multi-effect booster vaccine.  This does not replace current immunity, it builds multiplicatively on top of it.

Boost_Mortality.description: Specifies boosting effect on mortality immunity for naive individuals (without natural or vaccine-derived immunity) for a multi-effect booster vaccine.  This does not replace current immunity, it builds multiplicatively on top of it.

Boost_Threshold_Acquire.description: Specifies how much acquisition immunity is required before the vaccine changes from a prime to a boost.

Boost_Threshold_Transmit.description: Specifies how much transmission immunity is required before the vaccine changes from a prime to a boost.

Boost_Threshold_Mortality.description: Specifies how much mortality immunity is required before the vaccine changes from a prime to a boost.

Monthly_EIR.description: An array of 12 elements that contain an entomological inoculation rate (EIR) for each month.

Treatment_Fraction.description: The fraction of positive diagnoses that are treated.

Days_To_Diagnosis.description: The number of days from test until diagnosis.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: The unit 'cost' assigned to the intervention. Setting Cost_To_Consumer to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Diagnostic_Type.description: Type of malaria diagnostic. Possible values are: Microscopy, NewDetectionTech, Other.

Detection_Threshold.description: The diagnostic detection threshold for parasites in units of microliters of blood.

Event_Or_Config.description: Specifies whether the current intervention distributes a nested intervention (the Config option) or an event will be broadcast which may trigger other interventions in the campaign file (the Event option). See event list.

Positive_Diagnosis_Event.description: The next health care event that occurs for individuals who test negative. This is only valid if Event_Or_Config is set to 'Event'.

Positive_Diagnosis_Config.description: The intervention distributed to individuals if they test positive. This is only valid if Event_Or_Config is set to 'Config'.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If an individual's container has an intervention, set to 1 to prevent them from receiving another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention types.

Disqualifying_Properties.description: TBD-A list of Individual Property Key:Value pairs that cause an intervention to be aborted. Used to control the flow of health care access, e.g., to prevent the same individual from accessing health care via two different routes at the same time.

New_Property_Value.description: TBD-A marker associated with an intervention to indicate what the broad category of health care cascade to which an intervention belongs. This allows for additional control of the flow of health care, e.g., the use of Disqualifying_Properties to prevent simultaneous use of multiple pathways to care.

Circumcision_Reduced_Acquire.description: Reduction of susceptibility to HIV by VMMC.

Apply_If_Higher_Reduced_Acquire.description: If set to 0, the MaleCircumcision intervention can never be applied to someone who already has a MaleCircumcision intervention. If set to 1, a male who already has a MaleCircumcision intervention, but whose pre-existing MaleCircumcision intervention has a lower efficacy parameter (Reduced_Acquire) than the one about to be applied, will receive the higher-efficacy MaleCircumcision.

Distributed_Event_Trigger.description: When defined as part of an intervention block of class MaleCircumcision, this string defines the name of the column in the output files ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv and ReportEventRecorder.csv, which log when the intervention has been distributed.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

NodeID_To_Migrate_To.description: The destination node ID for intervention-based migration.

Is_Moving.description: Set to 1 to indicate the individual is permanently moving to a new home node for intervention-based migration.

Duration_Before_Leaving_Distribution_Typ.description: The shape of the distribution of the number of days to wait before migrating to the destination node for intervention-based migration. Possible values are: FIXED_DURATION UNIFORM_DURATION GAUSSIAN_DURATION EXPONENTIAL_DURATION POISSON_DURATION.

Duration_Before_Leaving_Fixed.description: The value to use for a fixed distribution of the number of days to wait before migrating to the destination node.

Duration_Before_Leaving_Uniform_Min.description: The minimum value to use for a uniform distribution of the number of days to wait before migrating to the destination node.

Duration_Before_Leaving_Uniform_Max.description: The maximum value to use for a uniform distribution of the number of days to wait before migrating to the destination node.

Duration_Before_Leaving_Exponential_Peri.description: The period (1/rate) to use for an exponential distribution of the number of days to wait before migrating to the destination node.

Duration_Before_Leaving_Gausian_Mean.description: The mean value to use for a Gaussian distribution of the number of days to wait before migrating to the destination node.

Duration_Before_Leaving_Gausian_StdDev.description: The standard deviation to use for a Gaussian distribution of the number of days to wait before migrating to the destination node.

Duration_Before_Leaving_Poisson_Mean.description: The mean to use for a Poisson distribution of the number of days to wait before migrating to the destination node.

Duration_At_Node_Distribution_Type.description: The shape of the distribution of trips to the destination node for intervention-based migration. Possible values are: Duration_XXX_Fixed Duration_XXX_Uniform_Min Duration_XXX_Uniform_Max Duration_XXX_Gaussian_Mean Duration_XXX_Gaussian_Std_Dev Duration_XXX_Exponential_Period Duration_XXX_Poisson_Mean.

Duration_At_Node_Fixed.description: The value to use for a fixed distribution of the trips to the destination node.

Duration_At_Node_Uniform_Min.description: The minimum value to use for a uniform distribution of the trips to the destination node.

Duration_At_Node_Uniform_Max.description: The maximum value to use for a uniform distribution of the trips to the destination node.

Duration_At_Node_Exponential_Period.description: The period (1/rate) to use for an exponential distribution of the trips to the destination node.

Duration_At_Node_Gausian_Mean.description: The mean value to use for a Gaussian distribution of the trips to the destination node.

Duration_At_Node_Gausian_StdDev.description: The standard deviation to use for a Gaussian distribution of the trips to the destination node.

Duration_At_Node_Poisson_Mean.description: The mean to use for a Poisson distribution of the trips to the destination node.

New_STI_CoInfection_Status.description: Determines whether to apply STI co-infection, or cure/remove STI co-infection.When called with 1, it sets the co-infection status to true. When called with 0, it sets the co-infection status to false.

Released_Number.description: Number of mosquitos released in the intervention.

Released_Gender.description: Gender of released mosquitoes. Possible values are: VECTOR_FEMALE VECTOR_MALE.

Pesticide_Resistance.description: Pesticide-resistance characteristics of released mosquitoes. Possible values are: WILD HALF FULL NotMated.

HEG.description: HEG characteristics of released mosquitoes. Possible values are: WILD HALF FULL NotMated.

Released_Genetics.description: The genetic properties of the released mosquito, e.g. HEG and pesticide resistance.

Mated_Genetics.description: The genetic properties of the mate if released mosquitoes have mated, e.g. HEG and pesticide resistance.

Released_Sterility.description: Sterility of released mosquitoes. Possible values are: VECTOR_FERTILE VECTOR_STERILE.

Released_Wolbachia.description: Wolbachia type of released mosquitoes. Possible values are: WOLBACHIA_FREE VECTOR_WOLBACHIA_A VECTOR_WOLBACHIA_B VECTOR_WOLBACHIA_AB.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: Unit cost per vaccine (unamortized). The unit 'cost' assigned to the intervention. Setting Cost_To_Consumer to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Prime_Acquire.description: Specifies priming effect on acquisition immunity for naive individuals (without natural or vaccine-derived immunity) for a multi-effect booster vaccine.

Prime_Transmit.description: Specifies priming effect on transmission immunity for naive individuals (without natural or vaccine-derived immunity) for a multi-effect booster vaccine.

Prime_Mortality.description: Specifies priming effect on mortality immunity for naive individuals (without natural or vaccine-derived immunity) for a multi-effect booster vaccine.

Boost_Acquire.description: Specifies boosting effect on acquisition immunity for naive individuals (without natural or vaccine-derived immunity) for a multi-effect booster vaccine.  This does not replace current immunity, it builds multiplicatively on top of it.

Boost_Transmit.description: Specifies boosting effect on transmission immunity for naive individuals (without natural or vaccine-derived immunity) for a multi-effect booster vaccine.  This does not replace current immunity, it builds multiplicatively on top of it.

Boost_Mortality.description: Specifies boosting effect on mortality immunity for naive individuals (without natural or vaccine-derived immunity) for a multi-effect booster vaccine.  This does not replace current immunity, it builds multiplicatively on top of it.

Boost_Threshold_Acquire.description: Specifies how much acquisition immunity is required before the vaccine changes from a prime to a boost.

Boost_Threshold_Transmit.description: Specifies how much transmission immunity is required before the vaccine changes from a prime to a boost.

Boost_Threshold_Mortality.description: Specifies how much mortality immunity is required before the vaccine changes from a prime to a boost.

Vaccine_Take.description: This specifies the rate at which delivered vaccines will successfully stimulate an immune response and achieve the desired efficacy. If vaccine_take is set to 0.9, then with a 90 percent chance, the vaccine will start with the specified efficacy, and with a 10 percent chance it will have no efficacy at all.

Acquire_Config.description: The configuration for multi-effect vaccine acquisition.

Transmit_Config.description: The configuration for multi-effect vaccine transmission.

Mortality_Config.description: The configuration for multi-effect vaccine mortality.

If there is skip oviposition, this is not the mortality per skip but the effective net mortality per gonotrophic cycle over all skips.

Efficacy.description: Represents the efficacy of a PMTCT intervention, defined as the rate ratio of MTCT between women receiving the intervention and women not receiving the intervention. A setting of 1 is equivalent to 100% blocking efficacy, and 0 reverts to the default probability of transmission, configured through the config.json parameter Maternal_Infection_Transmission_Probability.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If an individual's container has an intervention, set to 1 to prevent them from receiving another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention types.

Disqualifying_Properties.description: TBD-A list of Individual Property Key:Value pairs that cause an intervention to be aborted. Used to control the flow of health care access, e.g., to prevent the same individual from accessing health care via two different routes at the same time.

Target_Property_Value.description: The value of the user-defined group where the individuals will be transitioned.

Daily_Probability.description: The probability per day that an individual will move to the Target_Property_Value.

Maximum_Duration.description: Maximum duration of 'delayed-release' property change, in days.

Revert.description: Reversion rate, or the number of days until reversion, or a bool if reversion is allowed.

Antibody_Type.description: Antibody type.  Possible values are: CSP MSP1 PfEMP1_minor PfEMP1_major.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: When using the STIBarrier intervention to change defaults from demographics, Cost_To_Consumer determines the unit cost.  Note that there is no cost for condoms distributed using demographics-configured default usage probabilities.

Early.description: The left asymptote for the sigmoid trend over time.

Late.description: The right asymptote for the sigmoid trend over time.

MidYear.description: The time of the infection point in the sigmoid trend over time.

Rate.description: The slope of the infection point in the sigmoid trend over time. A Rate of 1 sets the slope to a 25% change in probability per year,

Relationship_Type.description: The relationship type to which the condom usage probability is applied.
