Base_Specificity.description: The specificity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals without the condition being tested receive a negative diagnostic test. When set to 1, the diagnostic always accurately reflects the lack of having the condition. When set to zero, then individuals who do not have the condition always receive a false-positive diagnostic test.

Base_Sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals with the condition being tested receive a positive diagnostic test. When set to 1, the diagnostic always accurately reflects the condition. When set to zero, then individuals who have the condition always receive a false-negative diagnostic test.

Treatment_Fraction.description: The fraction of positive diagnoses that are treated.

Days_To_Diagnosis.description: The number of days from test until diagnosis.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: The unit 'cost' assigned to the intervention. Setting Cost_To_Consumer to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Negative_Diagnosis_Event.description: The name of the event to broadcast when individual is found to NOT be Post-Debut age.

Event_Or_Config.description: Specifies whether the current intervention distributes a nested intervention (the Config option) or an event will be broadcast which may trigger other interventions in the campaign file (the Event option). See event list.

Positive_Diagnosis_Event.description: The next health care event that occurs for individuals who test negative. This is only valid if Event_Or_Config is set to 'Event'.

Positive_Diagnosis_Config.description: The intervention distributed to individuals if they test positive. This is only valid if Event_Or_Config is set to 'Config'.

Multiplier.description: TBD-A specific multiplier for the given habitat - the 'value' of the key:value pair.

VectorHabitatType.description: TBD - The habitat type/name for the specified species.

SpeciesName.description: TBD - The name of the species from Vector_Species_Names to have specific multipliers for this habitat type.

Larval_Habitat_Multiplier.description: The value by which to scale the larval habitat availability specified in Larval_Habitat_Types across all habitat types, for specific habitat types, or for specific mosquito species within each habitat type.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: Unit cost per vaccine (unamortized). The unit 'cost' assigned to the intervention. Setting Cost_To_Consumer to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Prime_Effect.description: Specifies the priming effect on [acquisition/transmission/mortality] immunity for naive individuals (without natural or vaccine-derived immunity)

Boost_Effect.description: Specifies the boosting effect on [acquisition/transmission/mortality] immunity for previously exposed individuals (either natural or vaccine-derived).  This does not replace current immunity, it builds multiplicatively on top of it.

Boost_Threshold.description: Specifies how much immunity is required before the vaccine changes from a priming effect to a boosting effect.

Vaccine_Take.description: This specifies the rate at which delivered vaccines will successfully stimulate an immune response and achieve the desired efficacy. If vaccine_take is set to 0.9, then with a 90 percent chance, the vaccine will start with the specified efficacy, and with a 10 percent chance it will have no efficacy at all.

Vaccine_Type.description: Type of vaccine to distribute in a vaccine intervention. Possible values are: - Generic - The vaccine can have all of "reduced_transmit", "reduced_acquire", and "reduced_mortality" fields and the vaccine will have both effects. - TransmissionBlocking - Specifies the fraction by which the infectivity of the infected and vaccinated Individual is reduced ("reduced_transmit"). - AcquisitionBlocking - Specifies the fraction by which the force of infection experienced by the vaccinated Individual is reduced ("reduced_acquire"). - MortalityBlocking - Specifies the fraction by which the disease-mortality rate of a vaccinated Individual is reduced ("reduced_mortality").

Efficacy_Is_Multiplicative.description: TBD-True implies that the vaccine efficacies are multiplied together, false implies additive.  This applies when the person is getting more than one vaccine.

Waning_Config.description: The configuration of drug-killing efficacy and waning.

Durability_Profile.description: The PKPD (pharmacokinetic) model type (FIXED_DURATION_CONSTANT_EFFECT or CONCENTRATION_VERSUS_TIME). Secondary_Decay_Time_Constant.description: The secondary decay time constant of the decay profile.

Drug_CMax.description: Drug maximum concentration for a dosing.

Drug_Vd.description: Volume of distribution for the drug.

This allows for additional control of the flow of health care, e.g., the use of Disqualifying_Properties to prevent simultaneous use of multiple pathways to care.

Changing_Effect.description: Highly configurable effect that changes over time, derived from WaningConfig.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If an individual's container has an intervention, set to 1 to prevent them from receiving another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention types.

Targeted_Individual_Properties.description: Individual Property key-value pairs to be targeted (optional)

Use_Property_Targeting.description: Set to 1 (true) -- or omit -- if you want to use the Targeted_Individual_Property parameter to limit the effect of this intervention to just certain individuals. Set to 0 to apply effect to everyone.

Killing_Config.description: TBD-A fraction of feed attempts that kill the vector. The rate at which the mosquito dies conditional on a successfully blocked feed. A parameter that is decayed.

Blocking_Config.description: TBD-A fraction of feed attempts that have been blocked. The rate of blocking indoor feeds on individuals with an ITN. A parameter that is decayed.

Usage_Config_List.description: TBD-List of WaningEffects who's effects are multipled together to get the usage effect.

Expiration_Distribution_Type.description: TBD-The type of distribution to use when calculating the time to discare the net.

Expiration_Period_1.description: TBD-Decay length of the first time scale.

Expiration_Period_2.description: TBD-Decay length of the second time scale.

Expiration_Percentage_Period_1.description: TBD-Percentage of draws where the first time scale is used.

Received_Event.description: TBD-Broadcasted when a new net is received - either first one or replacing existing one.

Using_Event.description: TBD-Broadcasted each time step that the net is used.

Discard_Event.description: TBD-Broadcasted when the user is discarding their net - either replacing existing one or due to expiration timer.

Box_Duration.description: Box duration of effect in days.
Box duration of effect in days.

Values.description: An array of values to match the defined Times.

Durability_Map.description: Time, in days, since the intervention was distributed to a multiplier times the Initial_Effect.

Expire_At_Durability_Map_End.description: Set to 1 to let the intervention expire when the end of the map is reached.

Reference_Timer.description: Timestamp at which linear-map should be anchored.
